description:
Cute place right on Union st!  I stopped in after my
Workout at basecamp and it was the perfect spot for some healthy post workout eats.  The lady explained how it worked and she was really nice.  

Basically it's already premade food, macros listed and you can get what you want and pay by weight.  They will heat it for you if you want to dine in. 

I enjoyed the steak, mashed cauliflower and roasted Brussels and a side of herbal hibiscus tea.  I loved it! My favorite was the mashed cauliflower...omg so delish and healthy.  Perfect Keto lunch too!
author: Julie B.

description: How could something so simple be so tasty?! This is food for the soul. Whenever I come to the area I have the easiest time making a decision on where I'm going to eat, even thoe there are some super tasty spots nearby. Food that caters to my buds AND my energy levels always wins in my book.
author: Zuri I.

description: Disappointing and overpriced. I'm ok with cheap and cheerful but then it should actually be cheap. They microwave the food in front of you. Erm, no.
author: Zara S.

description:
Sooooo good. 
Excellent place to stop in for a healthy & quick bite to eat. Everything is labeled with nutrition info and is pretty low-cal... great place to eat if you're looking to watch your diet! They even have grab & go meals if you're in a rush. The service has always been great.
Also, I'm obsessed with the mint chip smoothie. It's seriously so good- it tastes just like a milkshake!!
author: Catherine S.

description:
Let me start by saying that I appreciate the effort that has gone in to making a healthy place to grab food quickly. I like how they have nutritional information for their dishes. I also like how they have compostable plates and utensils. However, the execution is really seriously lacking. 

I stopped by for dinner, and I got spinach lasagna with a side of broccoli. The broccoli was almost inedible. They had gone way, way overboard with the lemon zest, and the whole preparation made the broccoli extremely bitter. As for the lasagna, you would be better off buying a frozen lasagna and reheating that yourself- this was cold in the middle, the cheese had solidified, and it just did not taste good. 

To be fair, it seems like this is more of a lunch spot, so maybe the food is fresher if you come during lunch hours. And, I got a smaller meal for about $8 which isn't too bad in San Francisco. Still, I will not be returning, and if I do, I definitely won't be having the broccoli.
author: Ayushi A.

description:
I only stopped in here because my best friend used to rave about it and I had just gotten my entire face waxed across the street at Bare. 

This place is reminiscent of a Whole Foods salad bar except more expensive and less yummy. Their whole system is confusing, some food is weighed, some is by scoops, no real menu except for smoothies. 

I got the tuna poke and the cauiliflower chickpea. I asked the guy behind the counter what goes good with the poke since I imagined having it atop something and he said the kale salad or the salmon or some other fish wtf. I do not want tuna poke on top of more fish that is insane. Thats like asking whats good with the kale salad and someone suggesting eating it with the Cesar salad. I just got a scoop of it alone instead. 

Maybe I'll try the smoothies sometime but the food was meh and by the time I was in there at 5pm it looked kind of sad and old, especially the poke.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Lite Bite is like the the organic, expensive salad bar you never knew you needed or wanted in your life. They have a mixture of pre-packaged meals, a-la-carte items, and smoothies. For all the a-la-carte items, everything is weighed--And cation, severe sticker shock may be experienced if purchasing things from the counter. 

Overall, I thought the salads tasted fresh with great flavors (I had the tomato and cauliflower/chickpea salad) and the smallest size is around $8. (again, sticker shock WILL be expected.) 

I also had the BBQ chicken.--I'm not going to lie, I really disliked how they "heat it up" for you but they basically just zap it in a microwave until it's warm.--Call me crazy, but for an organic, health-food place, the fact that they zap the food with some good ole' microwaved radiation seemed off-brand. 

Overall, if you're in the Marina, Lite Bite is a good option for a healthy, fast lunch spot. But the price point and hit-or-miss food quality make it a restaurant  you wouldn't want to add to your weekly or even monthly lunch rotation.
author: Liz S.

description:
I love Lite Bite! 

They have a ton of healthy food options for take out or dine in. 

Dishes include lemon chicken breasts, sesame chicken breasts, salmon, teriyaki salmon, tofu salad, grilled greens, vegan veggie tikka masala, roasted yams, etc. 

On top of their great selection of healthy food options, their staff is super friendly which makes a place like this so warm and welcoming. 

I will definitely eat here when I'm shopping in the area and want to eat healthy :)
author: Amanda R.

description:
Wanna eat lite on a FRYday?

You can resist it. All those bad, deep fried foods in unhealthy saturated fat were designed to make you overeat anyway. Same goes for foods laden with heavy sauces (cream) or topped with artery clogging Bacon. (MMM, bacon tho!) Be kind to your body and do it right at Lite Bite. 

Portions are just the right size, calories are listed upfront and prices are surprisingly affordable. I had a very good for you, rich in vitamins and heavy in fiber lunch here. A Tuscan kale salad with chopped apples,red onions and sweet yam. For an extra feeling of fullness, protein is essential so add a side like the ground turkey stuffed in red bell pepper. SO SO GOOD.

I feel great and don't have that uncomfortable feeling that comes with overstuffing myself when I eat bad foods. If you think it's hard to eat like this everyday (it is a challenge!) at least try it once a week, ideally on a FRYday. Mondays suck already as it is anyway.
author: Janice C.

description:
Your healthy living station.

For those in the business of keeping healthy and eating right, Lite Bite is the eatery for you.  Offering pre-made and pre-portioned meals to go, choice choose and pay meal options to stay, and healthy veggie smoothies, Lite Bite is great for after workout protein boosts, stocking up on healthy meals for the week, or just coming in for a quick meal when you don't have the time to make one yourself.

You'll find an excellent selection of meals covering various lean proteins, fruits, veggies, and carbs.  The smoothies are a great blend of green veggies such as kale and spinach, mixed in with sweeter fruits like pinapples and bananas.  

The biggest complaint is the price.  Be prepared to fork over more than $12 per meal, not including drinks.  The smoothies are a staggering $7, and while good, make it hard for me to justify getting them frequently.

If your wallet is full and you're looking for healthy eats, then Lite Bite has what you need.
author: Nadav P.

description: Amazing food and an wonderful service. We were in San Francisco for 11 days and when we wanted fresh and healthy food, that was our first choice!
author: Cam C.

description:
The first time I can say customer service was so bad that I was denied giving these people my business!

As I write this, I am on my 4th attempt to get on the line with someone from lite bite. 

I started calling at 6:20. I wanted to order food delivery. They were open but delivery labeled them closed. 

I called and was told I would need to call Grubhub and various delivery services and check in with them. Finally they took ownership. I told them i would call them back in 10 minutes so i can place and order and give them business!!!

10 minutes later, they have let my call go to dial tone over 4 times with 20 Minutes left till close.

Owners of Lite Bite - FIRE THE NIGHT TIME STAFF.
author: Norman R.

description: There were no mirrors in the bathroom. I spent $20 on a piece of salmon and a scoop of quinoa. When I went to the bathroom I was rudely reminded that I'm not Kim Kardashian.
author: Rachael N.

description:
If you ever jumped on that Weight Watchers band wagon, they have the food here all labeled with points. It's a weight watcher's dream come true. 

If you're not into that, and more into clean healthy eating with appropriate proportions, this place is still somewhat of a dream come true. 

As of lately, I've been popping in for lunch during the weekdays. If I want my food to go, I can grab it from their prepackaged section or get larger portions (for more than one person) packed up to go from the nice people behind the counter. 

They have options for the vegan, vegetarian, flexatarian, pescedarian, or paleo bunch. There are several breakfast, lunch, dinner or smoothie options. It could take me years to fully explore their menu! 

I love that there are always several veggie options and there is flavor to every single item. With glazes, spices, and fancy cooking styles. 

Why four stars, not five? Only thing I'm not a fan of is the microwaves used to heat the food up. It works, it convenient. I get it. I could always change that, get every thing to go and heat it up with an oven or stove top... So that's not that big of a deal! 

So, far, I have not had anything that tastes bad here!! It's all been finger licking good from their fresh pressed juices to roasted sesame (Mary's Organic Free Range) chicken breasts... And even their Brussels Sprouts! 

Enjoy!
author: Cassandra E.

description: Excellent source for healthy, reliable, good food in the neighborhood. Simple Mary's chicken, salmon, beef and even lower fat mac and cheese are all very good! Seasonal offerings such as roasted carrots and various soups available. The tuna salad is excellent! I have not tried the smoothies but there is a crowd that seems to approve. Staff is super friendly and welcoming at Union Street location.
author: E H.

description:
Healthy wholesome quick. Lots of variety and reasonably priced. What's not to like.
All the dishes are labeled with the nutritional information so you can make an informed healthy choice.
author: Gary B.

description:
Craving something healthy but too lazy to cook? Enter Lite Bite.

I've been here several times since moving to the neighborhood and have come to love it so much. Lite Bite is a super casual, relatively affordable grab-n-go (or sit down) restaurant where they label the nutritional information for every item. So if you're on a special diet or counting macros, this is the place for you. It makes healthy eating super accessible and easy. 

My favorite things to get:
- Tuscan kale salad with apple (massaged to perfection!)
- Ground turkey in bell pepper
- Whole wheat penne pasta
- Turkey meatloaf
- Mashed cauliflower (this is a game-changer)
- Mint chip smoothie (it's basically mint chip ice cream but made from healthy ingredients)

To top it all off, the employees are always very friendly and helpful. They will happily recommend items and heat up things upon request.

I wish I could eat like this everyday. Alas, I crave stuff that is bad for me way too often, but when I can exercise willpower, Lite Bite is there for me!
author: Valerie L.

description: A friend told me about little bites. And just what I wanted. Fresh, lite & tasty food. Really enjoyed my meal. So few places where you can get food like this. Simple, and very nicely seasoned.
author: Rylie Q.

description: I would like to start by appreciating the girl at the counter, very welcoming and very polite. Gave us a patient description of the many salads they have to offer. You can mix and create your own assortment. We had chickpea and cauliflower, with beans and corn and quinoa. Great mix of healthy and tasty. To top if off, the apricot oatmeal square was heavenly and I wish I could have an unending supply!!
author: Rupin K.

description:
I work in the area and happened to forget my lunch so I decided to grab something quick to eat at Lite Bite. There was a selection of items in the display case ranging from chicken breasts, turkey meatballs, lasagnas to different salads and even cookies. 

I loved that they have little cards that tell you how much calories go into a serving so you know exactly what you're consuming. They also indicate on the card how much it costs per serving or per pound. It's perfect if you're watching your weight.

I ended up ordering a serving of the spinach lasagna and asked them to warm it up for me. This spinach lasagna is made with wheat pasta in a white sauce topped with cheese. It was the perfect amount and I loved that while it was satisfying, it wasn't loaded with calories like you have gotten from other places.

I would definitely come back and order other dishes to try.

The food is not cheap, but it is good and it's perfect for people who are watching their weight.
author: Andrea G.

description:
Healthy, fast, easy, and not too over priced for the marina considering you're getting fresh made organic food.

Love their blue berry muffins, little too much!
author: Aaron K.

description:
This is a place that you think, "Good concept, poor execution." I love the idea of low caloried, organic, fresh, fast, and healthful prepared meals. 

They provide great nutritional information and ingredients so you can make a well informed decision on what you're consuming. 

Then, you order your mostly by the weight meal that they kindly ask if you would like it heated for you. Yes, that'd be wonderful, thank you! Then, disappointment falls upon you as you watch them heat your plate in the microwave. 

Then, it's time to walk up to the cashier and your eyes bug out due to the sticker shock of your meal. 

Then, you taste your bland turkey meatloaf topped with plain ketchup (no attempt to disguise), side of limp and dried veggies, and bland polenta. On top of that, they haven't mastered the use of the microwave since the meatloaf (which was less than 2" squared) was ice cold in the middle while the veggies were hellishly hot. 

I wanted to love this place but can't. Pass. Go to whole paycheck instead for their deli and salad bar. It's about the same price. Ut tastes better.
author: S C.

description:
The food here is solid and healthy.    Prices are reasonable.     Everything from enchiladas to salads to salmon with cous cous entrees for eat in or take out.    
They are set up on Eat24 for delivery or pickup which is convenient.    
They are pleasant staff as well.      The neighborhood needs more such places as Lite is great for lunch or dinner when you want food that's tasty, healthy, and fast.
author: chris b.

description: I'm in San Francisco on business and basically just ordering delivery for two weeks, watching chopped, and wondering how I got to be such a loser. Anywho, Lite Bite has made me feel slightly less gremlin-like because I actually find myself looking forward to eating said delivery. So far I've had the mole pie and the enchilada and both have been amazing (but definitely go for the enchilada). I also have my sister's bachelorette party on the beach in a week so its nice to know I can wolf this down and not worry that I'll be an actual beached whale because its under 500 calories. If I lived here I would come here questionably often, but I don't so all of you people that actually live here need to eat enough of the both of us. please and thank you
author: Mollie P.

description:
Always great and healthy food.
Love the chicken mole polenta!
author: Gabriele H.

description: Healthy food that is surprisingly tasty. Lite Bite is a quick and easy option for take out. Imagine something like a Whole Food cooked food counter but reasonably priced and down to earth. Everything is pre-made and they will warm it up for you shall you choose to dine in. Both vegan/vegetarian and carnivores would find to their liking.
author: Mona W.

description: I could eat at this cafe everyday! The food is absolutely delicious, not to mention healthy with a nice variety of choices. You determine the portion on your plate not the menu. I will definitely return to eat here on my next trip to San Fran. Thanks for helping me eat healthy while vacationing.
author: Lauren R.

description: Yum.  I love spots like this.  I just got a tasty Brussels sprout salad that really hit the spot. Was pretty good size for like $5.   I had on another visit some yams that were equally delicious.
author: Pauline C.

description: Super friendly staff; well-seasoned, healthy options; great prices! I loved how home-cooked my meal felt - convenience of eating out, say goodbye to guilt from doing so. Highly recommend! I had one of the kinds of chicken breast (can't remember which one because I asked for her recommendation), the mashed cauliflower, and the yams. Everything was great.
author: Ana M.

description:
I love this place. It takes guts to go all in on raw food and health food as a concept of it´s own so all credit to the owners. My go to things are the pea soup and salmon salad. (Also loved tomatoes and avocado mix but think it´s only seasonal) My only complaint is that too much have cilantro in it. So if you don´t like cilantro it´s hard to do the salads. 

I will miss you Lite Bite!
author: Hanna A.

description:
I started going to this place regularly around January, and just appreciate it more and more as time goes on.  Healthy food good on my diet, with a few "allowable" nutritional smoothies add up to a big plus in my book.

The owner (I think it is the owner) is always very nice, and my daughter (who is 6) likes their barbecue chicken quite a bit (it is always moist and juicy - even as a takeaway).  With the smoothies, the bell peppers with turkey meet and all of the offerings there is ton of variety and plenty of interesting ways to do vegetables.  I'm really glad to have Lite Bite in the neighborhood and as someone else said - I love having the nutritional information and ingredients easy to find.
author: Paul D.

description:
I'm slacking on making my lunch at home again, so consequently I've been suffering from sandwich-guilt lately and I wanted to try something healthy and new.  Lite Bite is exactly that. 

I really like that they tell you the calories up front.  Of course when you are eating out, this amount can fluctuate, but I trust these peeps.  Keep in mind though that this will be a "lite" bite.  You don't get a lot, but the ingredients are quality so you end up feeling full at the end of your meal.  I ordered the turkey meatloaf and the chicken polenta.  The meatloaf was very good and exactly what I was hoping for.  The polenta was tasty, but the chicken was really tough.  Next time I think I'd just get a bowl of polenta only instead.

Overall, a good, healthy option if you're in need of a quick and satisfying meal.  Be warned it arrives cold though!
author: Emily M.

description: Fantastic and surprisingly healthy food served with kindness. Order from an interesting variety of dishes at the counter
author: Ottis M.

description:
I work in the area and stumbled on this restaurant while I had some time to kill on the parking meter. The food is DELICIOUS and I could easily eat here very often. The service is very fast and all the staff are extremely friendly, so it's a joy to come here at the end of my shift and take some time to enjoy some healthier food options.

I've only been here a handful of times, so there's a lot of items on the menu I haven't tried yet. However, I would definitely recommend any of the pastas or salads to curb your appetite
author: Alexus S.

description:
Lite Bite might just be the healthiest "grab-and-go" place in the entire city.

I work right across the street from these guys, so you can say it's a semi-regular spot for me. Every time I've been there, I always got nothing but good service from them, and I feel like they deserve the exposure. They definitely have a very respectable mission, as they provide nothing but low-calorie, low-sodium healthy meals. 

Now, I wouldn't exactly say I'm an advcate for healthy meals. I do try my best to be healthy (working out, cutting out sugar drinks, etc.) but usually you would not see me in a place like this for lunch. Ever since I got my current job next door, things changed for the better. I find that there are days that I don't have time to have a proper lunch or bring my own, so Lite Bite has become my go-to. Not only can you you have a filling meal, but they offer so many options (lasaunga, chicken, eggplant, broccoli, rice, salad, pasta) that all have been prepared organically. It's basically like grabbing a fast food meal, except it's incredibly good for you. I ordered the pesto pasta with grilled veggies (see the pictures) and it was very delcious. While I can't exactly say it's the best pasta I've ever had, what I can say is that you always know you're getting top notch ingrediants here and supporting a local business.

Besides the wide array of healthy to-go meals they have, service here is top notch. Every person working behind the counter has always been incredibly kind to me. They always make sure to be attentive and never are short of suggestions when you aren't too sure what you want. 

The big negative is the pricepoint. You can expect to spend about $15 bucks at least. While they do have options for less than that, like salads for $10 or ordering in smaller amounts, it's no doubt a place where you pay premium for high quality ingrediants. I've said this in the past and I'll say it again. If you want the best, you have to pay like it's the best.

Final verdict: Lite Bite is a unique version of what you would typically think is a grocery store or a deli. It's a place that acts like a fast food joint, yet the only thing that truly resembles a fast food joint is just how fast you get the food. It's truly one of the best healthy options in the Marina if not the city.
author: Alex B.

description: Very polite crew here, great smoothies. I always get the smoothies and I love them!
author: William W.

description: First time in, no waiting which was a plus. The employee was super friendly and explained how it works. I had veggies and spice chicken, it was excellent. Fair price for a healthy lunch. Food was well cooked and seasoned. Also appreciate the compostable plates and utensils.
author: Emily S.

description: New favorite place in SF! The staff was super nice and helpful! The food is well priced with lots of options to choose from. The food is healthy but from what I've had so far (definitely try the enchilada) also delicious and filling. Will absolutely be coming back!
author: Nicole M.

description:
This is a great place if you like lean foods ,they have a variety of different dishes I only wished they didn't use a microwave to warm it up .
Customer service is very good !
author: Fabio T.

description: I have been coming to lite bite for quite some time but sadly I will no longer give them my patronage. The whole staff EXCEPT the male co-owner is amazing. The male co-owner has been nothing but rude to me despite the fact that I am a regular. He is condescending, cranky and patronizing. I particularly don't like how he treats his staff. I have witnessed on multiple occasions him being approached by staff with a question and him responding in a really rude manner. The absolute final straw was when I was waiting in line and moved to the side because a woman had to move her stroller. At the same instant he was walking in the door and we lightly bumped into each other, he barked "watch your self!" I will no longer support a man who is so full of himself and rude to his coworkers and customers anymore.
author: Sophie D.

description:
Love this place. They serve healthy portioned meals & smoothies at a very reasonable price- especially in the Marina. 

I'm partial to the Mint Chip smoothie: spinach, mint, banana, almond milk, spices & chocolate chips. Yum! Also, the Turkey Lasagna is delicious. 

This place is definitely worth checking out for all you health nuts in SF.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
The first time I walked by here I said "I'll never eat here, I'm not paying $15 to eat rabbit food - I'm not a skinny self conscious girl." 

Then one day I decided to walk in and look around. As it turns out a lot of this is food that I can prepare at home; not gross or disgustingly small portions of buzz-word health items. Real food! And sometimes I don't have time to make real food. This place delivers on that need, and in an honest and straightforward way - calories and macros listed out and you can order most things by weight if you happen to be into portion control, etc.

Walking up and down Union street, there is a decent variety of food options but they are all heavy and most of them are pricier than what I'm used to. I call it the "Marina tax". This not bargain basement but it's not over priced either...I will be back.
author: Katies F.

description:
I love Lite Bite. I love the concept. I love the food. I love the friendly staff. I love the location close to work. 

Eating healthy can be somewhat of a challenge. I bring most of my healthy, flavorful lunches to work. On those days that I haven't pre-planned well, it can be hard to find somewhere close by that makes tasty, healthy dishes! This is where Lite Bite steps in. This place is a diet godsend if you're watching your weight/calories/macros/ or want to maintain a healthy eating lifestyle. There is a quick grab-and-go cooler, or you can pick your own proteins/veggies/grains from their deli counter. They clearly display the ingredients, nutrition info, and WeightWatcher points if that's your thing. You can stay and eat in the cafe, or take a box to-go.

I can honestly say everything here is prepared well and is so flavorful. You don't need fat/salt/sugar for flavor and Lite Bite proves this with their lightened-up recipes. There is seriously something for everyone. My favorites are the turkey lasagna grab-and-go, or making my own box with a Mary's spiced chicken breast, sauteed broccoli, and grilled polenta cakes (!!!). Their meals always leave me full and with a good conscience.
author: Liz G.

description: I feel like they could do better. I was appreciative of the calories, but was still surprised by small portions and low quality of the cooking. It was over priced for what we got. Also I think a lot of the options had sugar unnecessarily. If it's going to be a health conscious place, it would be nice to have sugar free options (or natural substitutes)
author: Katie S.

description: Went there one day with a patient and omg the blueberry protein shake was amazing and delicious. Definitely will be back. Smelled so yummy when we walked in. I have to try the turkey lasagna.
author: Brooklyn A.

description:
I purchased the two day meal plan groupon and was not impressed by any of the dishes I received (bbq chicken, enchilada, lasagna). All dishes were very bland and had a bad texture. 
Maybe there is a real market for this "lite" food, but honestly I'll take the extra 100 calories for better flavor and meal.
author: Amanda R.

description:
We need more of this kind of place.

Healthier very tasty alternatives ready to go.

Eat there or take it to go.

Huge variety - about 20 or so dishes - meats, veggies, pasta...price is determined by weight so you can get a scoop of this and that.

They have a juice/smoothie bar too which I have not tried yet.
author: Matt W.

description: Came here on a visit to SF after a yoga class down the street. It is fast and healthy with plenty of options and calories clearly listed. I got a few of the sides. Enjoyed the polenta and tofu more than the grilled veggies. Tried the omega smoothie which was sweet and tasty but over priced. It's appropriately priced for health food and had plenty of tables and chairs.
author: Alyssa H.

description: Respectfully- Not bad if you are 'done for the day', and happen to be walking by on the way home. I like the chicken enchiladas myself. I think they have some descent lasagna as well.
author: Kirk M.

description: Ordered for delivery through Grub hub. Order came 20mins after placing it. Ordered a juice and the spiced chicken with yams. Haven't tried the juice yet, b it the chicken and yams have no flavor and the chicken is dry. I only give the 1 star because of the quick delivery, but I'm not going to try this again.
author: Princess D.

description: I had the turkey lasagna, which was microwaved, tasted good, and cost a little over $7. It was definitely a lite bite in that I had to get something else to eat after, but of course, that kind of portion problem may not extend to you. Solid overall.
author: Patrick F.

description: Pleasantly surprised by Lite Bite! Walked by while doing errands and decided to pick up some food to take home. I got the chicken mole and quinoa ~ $11. Portions were definitely a good size, and it was quite tasty! Will definitely come back on nights when I'm too tired to make dinner.
author: Teresa K.

description:
I had lasagna, a salad and a carrot coco juice. Everything was excellent. I'm very picky with food and those Lasagna felt like home. (France)
I highly recommend this place.
author: Cami T.

description:
I'm obsessed with the food and macro breakdown from here. I count my macros-- making eating out a little more difficult, but they go ahead and do it for you! Simple input. The food is full of flavor, usually a surprise for "healthy food." I like that they don't make healthy food boring, because it shouldn't be. 

However, they only received 2 stars because of customer service. The girls measuring out the food are amazing-- but the owner/cashier (slightly older male) has the worst "bedside manner" ever. He was extremely patronizing when I offered to pay before my food was ready (I forgot they ran the price by the weight). Okay, my fault-- I took that sassy response. Then he told me, "to go and wait while he served paying customers." Still a paying customer-- but okay. His tone was really starting to get me at this point. Then as I stood to the side and used a pen to write down some of the nutrient information (to come back and get it), he told me to let the PAYING CUSTOMER use "my pen," and then self corrected, "well it's mine, so yeah-- we need it." 

I was over it at this point. I didn't respond angrily verbally, but I was dismissive, paid, and will not be back. Learn to be respectful sir. I was purchasing several meals a week from here. No longer.
author: Hailey P.

description:
I MISS Mr. Elliptical!

I miss the way he makes me all hot and sweaty....

The way he raises my spirits when I'm feeling down....

The way he makes me feel like I can conquer the world, one bite at a time instead of one plate at a time...

Most importantly, I love how Mr. Elliptical does NOT talk back; talk about a dream guy.

Sadly, Mr. Elliptical and I are on a break. Two Fridays ago, I fell in the bathroom at John Colins and badly sprained my ankle. I can stand pain but what I can't stand is: "Cherylynn, ummm...I think you need to go shoe shopping." *Looks down at foot* https://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/photo/xVUweojQQsmhqB51x17ypg/l.jpg "My ankle is sprained! I don't have fat feet, dammit!" *POUT*

Since I can't work out, I thought to prevent gaining weight during our "break" (well, attempt not to at least), I should consume as many calories as I burn at rest (avg. 1,500 calories/day); figuratively speaking of course. This is easier said than done especially when a salad at Cheesecake Factory can be up to 1,700 calories. WTF?

Enter Lite Bite.

Lite Bite makes eating healthy EASY without sacrificing flavor. Everything on the menu has the calorie listed per a serving size including the Weight Watcher point value. Chicken Enchilada, Turkey Meatloaf, Atlantic Salmon, Prosciutto, Bleu Cheese & Fig Sandwich, and etc., take your pick, everything is under 350 calories except two salads.

The Whole Wheat Lasagna (350 Calories-$6.25) w/ Ground Turkey, Low Fat Ricotta & Low Fat Mozzarella was deliciously filling. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3hInKoS_u0FPJMIpbITsHw?select=MwJFaYUNJyy9SIhTlQ2k9Q The noodles were al-dente, the ground turkey tender, and the chunky tomato sauce was vibrantly tangy with a touch of herbaceousness from the basil. The duo of low fat cheeses gave it a creamy richness reminiscent of the high caloric original.

If you're looking for a lighter meal, the Chicken Enchilada (230 Calories-$4.75) is a great option. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3hInKoS_u0FPJMIpbITsHw?select=dX6lyy1ny9fQn8I4x0TT9w Lower in carbs but packed with protein from the bountiful tender shreds of seasoned chicken, the enchilada gets a nice kick from the accompanying red chili sauce.

I know I'm very clumsy but this time, it was ALL Mr. Jack Daniels' fault. Really.

OTHER NOTES:
*Entrees & sides sold by the pound or by single serving size
*Sandwiches are pre-made
*Vegetarian friendly
*Seasonal specials available
*6-7 tables for sitting
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Everything here is delicious and healthy!!! 
The prices are about average, definitely not cheap but not ridiculous either for a health place in this neighborhood. I love the variety of foods that this store has!  A little tip- try their water- it's weird but I think it's the best water I've ever had. The water at the end of the cash register is very crisp, and super cold so on a sunny day,  it's so refreshing. 
Try their muffins, cookies, lasagna, veggies, everything is yummy!
author: J C.

description:
I really love this little place. 

Anytime I have an appointment at one of the trendy, pricey spas on Union, I go to Lite Bite for a light bite. 

The enchilada is great. I get it every time with a side of some veggies. 

I'm so sad that Lite Bite used to have little sandwiches that were discontinued. This happened about 2 or 3 years ago so maybe I should just get over it by now.
author: Irina R.

description: Well, what can I say? Lite Bite is my favorite go-to restaurant to order from on GrubHub. I would always order their grilled salmon & quinoa combo with one of their smoothies. The salmon is always tasty, and I love the other ingredients they combined with it! Also, their smoothie is the bomb and always arrives at the perfect temperature. Try their omega and their blueberry smoothie. Ordering from them is always a treat~! I wish they had a SoMa location so I can just walk there and order all the time~
author: Nadine A.

description:
Beautiful, clean little deli style spot. I just had to find a bathroom quickly so I purchased an organic boiled egg. 

Egg was scrumptious and bathroom was the CLEANEST bathroom I have found in San Francisco to DATE. 

Definitely going back during a meal time to try out the other delicious looking food and of course use that bathroom again!
author: Morgan D.

description:
Today was my first time visit and I'm pretty much addicted. My favorites so far are:
grilled salmon fillet with pea puree on top, the cauliflower with chickpeas, broccoli rabe and the turkey meatballs. 

I'll be back for sure!
author: Helen Y.

description:
Minus one point because it is pricey.

Other than that,
-Delicious turkey lasange!!
-OMG BEST SMOOTHIE EVER, MINT CHIP! Very refreshing and you will love it!!
-LOVE LOVE THE CALORIE COUNTS
author: Karen J.

description:
I love this place! The people are so friendly, and it's such a sunny yummy healthy place to eat after I get whatever pampering I'm in the marina for.. I'll be there after every facial or massage from now on!

The bbq polenta was DELICIOUS, as were the quinoa salads. I had a tough time deciding between all the different dishes, but I have a feeling you can't go wrong. YUM!
author: Vivian H.

description:
I will pay more $$$ for quality food! 
You can taste the freshness and the yummy healthy goodness energizing your body.

So far from my one visit I have tried -

-Zucchini Ribbon: yummy thai inspired flavors. veggies were crunchy and refreshing!
-Cuban Chicken Salad: as indulgent as healthy gets! loved the eggs and peas. YUM!
-Roasted Carrots: great bite - not overly soft, but not too tough either
-Yams: delicious. I could eat a bucket. 
(clearly I was a hungry hungry hippo when I made my stop)

Food is not sodium ladened and labelled with ingredients, protein, fat, calories, etc. 

** got 1/2 pint and pints of the dishes - bill came out to $26 but lasted me lunch and dinner ( which I shared with my bf - he approved as well ! )

can't wait to try everything this place has to offer and of course - the smoothies!!!

** the lady that helped me with my order was SUPER nice. so sweet!
author: Selina W.

description:
Delicious turkey lasagna with crispy broccoli.  I'll be back for seconds.

- The Arp darp King
author: Spencer B.

description:
Love this concept of actually knowing what I'm eating and how many calories! Revolutionary! 

My favorites here are the turkey lasagna (noms) and the brain boost smoothie. Everything I've tried has been really good.
author: Tasha D.

description: This place is proof that healthy food doesn't have to be bland. The selection is fantastic and all I've tasted was really great!
author: Jens K.

description:
The food here is so dang yummy I recommend it despite two unfortunate experiences when we were here. 

First of all and forgivable, the manager/cashier/whatever was perplexed when  I asked him for a high chair. He was very sweet but flummoxed, as though I'd asked him to accommodate a wild exotic bird.

Secondly, SOME CRAZY PERSON literally, LITERALLY(!) almost kicked my friends ass because we had never been there and were not hip to the ordering process. She was screaming in my friends face. I missed this because I was in the bathroom, but people were still in shock and the manager was apologizing to my friend!

But holy crap, this stuff is so good, and convenient, and healthy.
author: Jackie D.

description:
If you know the basics of healthy eating, calorie counting, or tracking macros with fats, carbs, and protein (thanks p90X!), you will LOVE this place! I know I do! :)

Everything is easily displayed to keep track of what you're eating in terms of the F, C, and P intake, as well as total calories. 

Buuuuttt...even if you don't understand what I just said know that this is one of the few places that actually has an extensive list of healthy food that you don't have to be guilty eating. Fun fact: most items at Subway are NOT that healthy (mostly higher fat than expected)

A bit on the pricey side, but it is tasty and healthy, and, let's be honest...in the Marina...so it is expected :(

If only they had another location closer to me...
author: Ian C.

description: I went for the first time today after driving by daily wondering what it had to offer.I had a chicken enchilada,mole pie,mashed cauliflower,and a sparkling blood orange soda to wash it all down.It cost $22 total (a bit pricey), but was amaze balls and reasonably portioned so I could breathe afterwards.I only gave them 4 stars because it's a little on the pricey side but the food is definitely tasty and fresh.I will definitely be going back!!!
author: Harriet A.

description: Still good as ever, I go here all the time... that is whenever my primal urge to go to nearby Roam Burger can be quelled. I still like all their core items like chickpeas and cauliflower and the spiced chicken. I do wish they'd cycle in a few more options, I never seem tempted to try something new. Overall they got a great and simple formula - healthy takeaway, shocked there aren't more places like this.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
I stopped by here just on a whim during the Union Street Fair. I decided to give their drink a try. I was warned that it was not a "sweet" drink.

I ordered the Mint and boy were my taste buds super happy!

I loved it, it wasn't sweet, but it was about right!

I've gone back a couple times to enjoy it again. 

The staff is really friend.
Service is fast.
Healthy food.
My only gripe, the price was steep (about $8) for the drink.

But definitely different and they offer some good healthy foods too.
author: Roger A.

description:
Despite having healthy, ready made food this is primarily a carry-out, even though the owners have provided tables. It is the plainest space, no decor, no ambiance.

Since I am not a fan of reheated food (unless it's in my own kitchen), this was probably a poor choice. There was no effort to create a pleasant dining atmosphere so I certainly did not feel like a guest. When I pay to eat out I like to savor good food while mentally distancing myself from cooking at home.

The owners are offering customers quick wholesome meals in the Marina. I can appreciate that value, but to be honest, I'm never in that great a hurry.
author: Lynn S.

description:
Always delicious. I wish their was an easier way to order for delivery! 

I've gotten the salmon, quinoa and corn, and cauliflower. All were very good, and would order again.
author: Therese M.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Lite Bite yet. This is a great spot for a quick and healthy snack or meal. The service is always really friendly and patient and the food is consistently good. What else can you ask for? 

The food is all very fresh and not that expensive for the quality.  Lite Bite has mastered making simple, low-calorie foods taste great!  I love that I can pick just the right amount of food that I'm in the mood for instead of having a preset amount given to me.  For example, on some days, I may want 3 grilled tomatoes, and on others, I may want 8.  Either way, Lite Bite is happy to accommodate your each and every need, from 3 tomatoes, to 8. 

Favorites:
- rainbow quinoa (new item)
- black bean salad
- Asian tofu salad 
- chicken drumsticks 
- salmon 
- grilled portobello mushrooms (new item)
- grilled tomatoes (new item)

Great for dine-in or take-out!  And for those with a sweet tooth, their cookies and chocolate pudding are also amazing and are unbelievably low in calories.
author: Juliana K.

description:
I love Lite Bite, and wish they had one in the Mission, where I live!  

I grab dinner here about once a month, and really like their healthy, low-calorie, and flavorful fare.  I enjoyed the Tuscan kale salad tonight with the Mary's spiced chicken breast.  I'm also a fan of their Bulgur salad. 

The service is very friendly and efficient.  

The prices are on the higher side, depending on what you order (for example, the salmon and asparagus can be an expensive combo!), but it's worth the convenience.
author: Barnali D.

description: Awesome healthy food. Lentil salad, broccoli rabi and quinoa with corn were all great!
author: Cynthia F.

description:
I like this place a lot. The portions are small and healthy yet still filling. Pricey though.

Recommend if you are in the area.
author: Ethan K.

description: It is always nice to have clean eating options in the city.  At times, I'm full speed ahead with gym, work and social activities that I fail at meal prep.  Recreationally, I am preparing for my next bodybuilding competition; therefore, I need to be aware of macros.  What I love about this place is flavor, macros and nutrition.  Even for those who are just looking to clean up their nutrition will benefit here.  Compared to self-meal prep, it saves time.  It isn't as expensive as other services that I have tried and it is convenient.  I will be back!
author: Hiromi N.

description: I stopped in for a quick lunch here. Got the tuna poke with Brussels sprouts salad and roasted chickpeas and cauliflower. Poked was ok, nothing fabulous. Shredded Brussels sprouts were a bit bland. Cauliflower chickpeas were enhanced by the Surprising inclusion of green olives. Meal was a bit overpriced for what it was, and presentation left much to be desired. This place may be better as a location for take out. Nothing wrong, just nothing to get excited about.
author: Arugula F.

description:
Lite Bite delivers high quality and tasty food without the calories. At first I didn't think that they had enough options, but in reality they do with the roughly 10 proteins and 10 veggies/sides to choose from. The prices are very reasonable and they serve Ritual Coffee and other fantastic beverages like real aloe juice w/ honey, sparking cucumber water with citrus essence, and some kickin' iced green tea.

We went family style to maximize our taste experience:

Grilled Salmon - the priciest item on the menu and worth it. Light and delicious, you won't be unhappy with this choice.
Turkey Meat Loaf - this one I'll try again. I love regular meat loaf but avoid it because of the calories. However, Lite Bite's turkey meat loaf has about 40% of the calories of the regular stuff and taste a lot better w/ all of their spices.
Turkey Lasagna - this is another gem for the Italian cuisine fans that don't want the calories.

The only dish that I'd pass on for our next visit is the Moroccan spiced chicken. I think that this is one that many will enjoy...but it just wasn't for me.

The prices are great, service is friendly, location is magnificent although parking is a challenge, and food taste great. Lite Bite is a solid 4 stars for me.
author: John Z.

description:
A winner for a good lunch:) 

Great healty food to an affortable price! Helpful staff that lets you have a tast of their different selections.
author: Christine B.

description: Friendly service and tasty food. Alittle overpriced for what you get. Nice that they give samples to try if you ask. Parking can be difficult in the area. Would highly recommend chicken polenta salad or enchilada.
author: Cindy W.

description: Ordered from postmates and said go with store recommendation for substitution if there wasn't something available. Went with the meat loaf with sautéed broccoli and cauliflower mash. Obviously there was no mash because I just get 20 pieces of broccoli and a piece of meatloaf not even the length of my thumb? Seriously? That's your substitution? Not impressed at all. So no worth $10.95 and I won't be ordering from here again. Disappointed!
author: Kirsten T.

description:
Calorie counters can rejoice. Litebite has the calorie counts for all its items. Think of it as a low calorie deli with 2 cases of salads, entrees (lasagna, enchiladas, chicken, salmon, pork chops), sandwiches and drinks. They also have Ritual Coffee.
 
I think everything is prepared in advance so that you can grab and go...or they'll heat things up for you if you want to dine there. Samples were offered. The inside is bright, clean and modern.

* Grilled vegetable sandwich($3.99): It's the size of English muffin breakfast sandwich, cute mini ciabatta like bun filled with a bit of Rondele soft cheese, thin slices of grilled veggies (eggplant, zucchini) and a flavorful sundried tomato spread, pretty good, simple, would have been nice with some fresh basil, and something crunchy (pickled onions?)
* Butternut squash soup ($7.50 a pint): thick, sweet, pureed style, good but could use some fresh herbs or an extra kick

They care about portion control, so don't come too hungry.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Really love this place for a pre-made meal! A little expensive, and the taste seems a bit compromised due to health purposes (but that's the point, right?), but a solid stop if you're looking for measured portion control and a to-go lunch/dinner. Cauliflower and chickpeas salad is garlicky and yummy, and the salads always have good, fresh greens.

Staff is always very friendly and helpful too!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Lite bite has become my go-to for quick and healthy meals. It is really the only place I feel like I can count on (other than my own cooking) that has fresh and organic ingredients that are not loaded with sodium and sugar. I have not tried anything here that I haven't liked and you can easily walk out of here with dinner for about $10, which is a deal in SF. 

I think it's important that you know what you are getting when you come here. This isn't where you come if you want a meal bursting with flavor and calories. It 's not where you come for a "splurge" meal. The owners value healthy and low calorie cooking above all else, without compromising flavor. They also have the most amazing smoothies (the Omega is my favorite), and just started serving breakfast on-the-go items like breakfast sandos and oatmeal squares that are wayyy yummier and healthier than anything you would get at Starbucks. 

The owners (who are always there) are also some of the nicest people and always give helpful hints on how best to prepare your to-go orders.
author: Ashley L.

description:
Hands down - this is the type of food I WISH I could cook: healthy, eclectic, flavorful food! However, I do wish they worked on their decor. 

Rumor has it they may open up a  Polk street restaurant. WIN!
author: Kendra C.

description:
I'm unsure what the fuss is all about. It was recommended to me by someone who lived down the street. I went in for a quick dinner to go and grabbed the salmon, yams, and kale salad. It cost almost $20. I wouldn't pay that much for the food I received at a sit down restaurant! It was ok food, but I found that it wasn't seasoned enough and didn't really pack a punch. For the price and reviews, I would have expected more.

That said I love the concept and business mission statement. And the service was great! 

I'm hoping that my experience was a one time fluke and the next time I try it the food will be more impressive. If so I will definitely be giving this place more stars and updating my review.
author: Laura C.

description: Happen to be in the area and walked into this joint. Very nice and welcoming employees. Great food and ambiance. Just like home.
author: Bhavnish S.

description:
A hot piece of turkey lasagna is exactly what I was craving. This place delivered tasty, healthier and substantial options. They list calories and warm it to perfection. I'm looking forward to returning for a green smoothie and chicken with rice. I was offered a small sample of the kale salads (bomb) and left me wanting more. This is a unique eatery that satisfied a starving gal.

If you want a healthy, fast option then try it out. You'll likely be satisfied...but wanting more!
author: Jen V.

description:
I've been working on union street for a year now and lite bite is my go to lunch spot. I go because the food is always super fresh, not once have I ever had something that tasted old. The shop is deli style and things are weighed out. Other deli places sometimes will serve stuff past it's prime, but not here. They use lots of organic fresh ingredients. Mary's free rage chicken, organic eggs and wild caught salmon. I go because the food is amazing, an extra plus is that all dished here are low calorie and low fat.
The staff is always friendly and helpful. Always the same crew around which makes me feel more inclined to come in and visit familiar faces. The gentleman who runs it is great as well, he is really passionate about healthy fresh tasty food. And his enthusiasm and the care and the pride he takes in what he serves really shows. Given the area everything here is pretty fairly priced. U can get out of there with a yummy lunch for about 9-12 bucks.
author: Francisca H.

description: We were walking in the Marina with our dog looking for healthy food. Found this place where you can specify exactly how much you want of everything. Minimal oil, many vegan options. We each picked out our lunch and carried it to a nearby park where we were able to enjoy it with our pup. No outdoor tables sadly.
author: Roberta J.

description: Watching your figure? Then this is the place to go! They portion their food so well and the ability to order a la carte is so helpful when one is on a diet. The food is healthy and tasty: I tried the ground turkey lasagna and some of the crab cakes-what's not to love? I'm gonna try their mashed cauliflower next.
author: Michael G.

description: I was looking for a healthy, quality, snack before going to Crunch, and all I could find was pastries on Union street until running into this little gem. Grabbed myself a delicious grilled chicken breast and freshly made blueberry protein shake.  Oh yeah, and with a food safety score of 100. Thanks for the hookup LiteBite!
author: T Q.

description:
I saw the sign that said "don't undo all your hard work" that showed a woman exercising and I though it sounded worth a try.

The service was amazing, the gentleman (owner?) who helped me offered me samples of anything, free refills on the most delicious green ice tea and even weighed my food for me so I knew exactly how many calories it was. 

The cauliflower and chickpea salad with the lemon chicken was delicious, fast and under 400 calories. I'm full and I'm going to get some of that salad to go. I wish I'd found this place two years ago when it opened.
author: E S.

description:
Love Lite Bite! 

I'm not a particularly healthy person (major understatement) but there are days that even I feel the need to tone it down and throw in a salad for a meal. I ended up discovering Lite Bite on one of those rare days and fell completely in love. 

Now, I try to eat here about 3 times a week on average. The food is extremely healthy, made from the freshest ingredients and actually delicious. Notice how I didn't say it's delicious for a healthy restaurant. That's what I love about Lite Bite the most - the food is tasty in comparison to other lunch spots, both the healthy and the unhealthy ones. 

My personal favorites are the Asian Tofu Salad, the Rainbow Quinoa and the cauliflower garbanzo beans. They are oozing with flavor, very healthy and completely fresh. And the prices are very reasonable. 

They also let you try out samples before ordering so that you can ensure you'll love it. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
There was definitely something dodgy about one of my lite bite choices. Salads sitting in a fridge all day- what was I thinking.  I basically became acutely nauseous and spent the entire day feeling queasy. Here's what I tried. 

Beet salad: delicious 
Cauliflower- I've become a big fan of cauliflower and thought they did a fantastic job
Chicken burrito- borriingg!!I could have made this at home
Cookie: Gross- tossed it out..

Total bummer because I enjoyed most of what I ate, but I did not enjoy the aftermath. Its hard to return after such a miss, but I could see why people would love this place. Portion control, interesting, tasty salad choices, calorie counts. Its a weight watcher dream come true...
author: Ritu K.

description: I am totally in love with this place. It's in the heart of the Marina, and they place the total macros for each piece of food right there for you to know. I'm currently on a pretty strict nutrition regiment, so this place is a dream come true for someone like me.
author: Josh W.

description:
Last night LiteBite gave me horrible food poisoning. I ordered a small piece of meatloaf, 2 meatballs, and a 1/2 pint of broccoli. Two hours after eating...I started to get the shivers. Like the bad kind including the sweats. 30 minutes later I ran to the bathroom and UP came the LiteBite food. 

I didn't sleep all night. I was in the bathroom most of the time. I'm still in bed with zero energy right now (next day). 

Does LiteBite even cook their own food? I never smell food cooking AND I always see food service/delivery trucks dropping off food in the mornings. 

I'm not happy and I won't go back.
author: Tom R.

description:
Okay seriously if you're the type of person even looking at the reviews for a place like this THEN YOU MUST GO, IT'S PERFECT FOR YOU!

The calorie counts are so low it's amazing, and the food tastes SO good! Highly reccomend the chicken enchiladas and the polenta and the lasagna.

If you don't believe me that it really is THAT good, after finishing my meal that I took "to go" I came all the way back just to stock up on enough meals to get me through a week because I (sadly) like 3 hours away.

GO HERE YOU WON'T REGRET IT
author: Maggie B.

description: My dad got the turkey lasagna ("literally the best lasagna I've ever had"), the polenta, the tofu salad ("seasoning is delicious"). My dad is the harshest food critic I know and he KNOWS his tofu. Highly recommend this place for yummy, healthy, but pricey food!!
author: Taylor A.

description:
I am on a very strict diet, so the first two times I dropped in to Lite Bite, they weren't prepared to accomodate me. However, this past weekend, they created a salad just for me; no dairy, at least 2 cups of mixed greens, tomatoes, and 4 full oz of chicken breast. Since it was the only thing I could eat for a while, it was important that it be filling. I was very satisfied until dinner time. 

I came in again today for 5 oz of chicken and half a pound of grilled veggies. The owner treated me to a cold iced tea, which was nice. The whole meal was under 300 calories and $10, which makes it healthy and affordable. 

My clients have already started comming here after their workouts. Now I can make specific suggestions for meals. I will be thrilled when they get more selection for a salad bar.
author: Linda S.

description: My sister told me she wanted something light, and by the name, this place seemed like it might be good for that. I think it ended up being exactly what we were hoping for--we got our food quickly, there was a light-filled, clean place to sit and enjoy our salmon and potatoes, and the prices weren't too bad. The employees behind the counter were really patient and helpful as we tried to decide.
author: Michelle G.

description: It's  good but they really need just a regular salad with oil and lemon. Like I want a side salad with my lunch not always sweet potatoes and broccoli.
author: Stacy B.

description:
This place rocks. It's so much easier to count macros and portion meals when someone else does the legwork. It could be a little pricey--but so can gym memberships and medical bills.

Basics:
+ The food tastes great.  Clean options with transparent food descriptions.
+ The service is stellar because they put in effort to tailor the meal to your request. 
+ It's styled like a deli, but they'll zap your food and have decent seating.
author: Diane N.

description:
Love the food here, just let them arrange what you would like to eat from the counter and pay by weight.  Always delicious and staff helps checking on the ingredients if you're allergic to something. Always feel good and goes well with Paleo Diet if you're looking for that kind.
Only the here on yelp recommend energizer Smoothie was not so much my thing- tasted bit too healthy-spinachy.
author: Anna K.

description:
I took friends that were visiting from Boston.....we all loved it!  #1Top of my list for several reasons: Clean, great food (100% of everything we tried was excellent, perfectly cooked, deliciously seasoned), healthy choices, friendly/generous owners, inviting location & café, it had a great "vibe"....I never write reviews but this place was worth taking a few minutes to recommend.
Try it and I'll see you there because I'll be going back frequently :)

Grande Grazie from the iPhone girl
author: Alana R.

description:
Consistently delicious food! I seriously can't rave enough about how good the food is, I haven't tried a thing I don't like. The thing I like the most?! It's healthy! And perfect for those who are conscious about calorie intake and nutritious ingredients.

My favorite dish by far is the chicken enchilada. It's got a thin corn tortilla and is stuffed full with chicken (very generous portion of chicken!). The sauce that comes with it is very tasty. Best part of the dish?! It's only 230 calories for the whole thing!

My favorite side dish is the cauliflower chickpea dish - it's got a great flavor, yum! The quinoa is also great. Recent discovery that is a must try are the yams, so flavorful!

Honestly, I could go on all day about how great the food is, trust me, give it a try.

The staff are great. Very patient in portioning out all of my dishes. The owners are a very sweet couple and go out of there way to tell you about the great ingredients and recipes.

Love love love this place - it's quickly becoming a staple in my diet!
author: Krista S.

description:
haven't written a yelp review in 3 years...but decided to break my hiatus because the green smoothie was THAT good.

do yourself a favor and get the ENERGIZER - spinach, coconut, mint, avocado, banana, date, almond milk and spices. 

just WOW. one sip and you know why it's called the energizer. it has all the greens and healthy ingredients you need, but it's the SPICES that make it. idk what it is - some combination of nutmeg and cinnamon? it's like that goodbye kiss at the end of the date that came out of nowhere - refreshing, delicious, and so goddamn exhilarating and wonderful that you just want more and more. 

best part? only 240 calories --- what????

sure, it's $7.50, but it's a date that will keep me feeling good for a long long time ;)
author: Evelyn S.

description:
I LOVE this place!!! My bf and I discovered this place when we were on a healthy kick last summer and decided to give it a try. We've never once regretted it. All the items are delicious AND healthy for you! Best part is that the calories are already calculated and laid out for you to see to have a better idea of what to choose and how much. We both keep coming back to our two faves: the meatloaf and the bulgar with wild mushrooms. Yum yum! 

We've met and spoken with the owner several times. Everyone that works there is super nice, friendly, and helpful. It's just such a shame that this is the only location as it's a bit of a drive for us, but we willingly make the trek every month or so.

Parking is fine during the day time, but as evening approaches it becomes increasingly difficult. 

I think the prices are fair given how much you would spend at another fast food joint for much less healthy food. But no kidding - the clean living can cost you a couple of pretty pennies. 

I'm so in love with this place, I swear even their WATER is phenomenal! :P Please try this place out if you're considering. Also, you can take extras to go to heat up another night - one less drive to go though!
author: Jasmin B.

description: Really good salads, you can mix and match any combinations of salads. I got organic tofu salad, organic kale and yam salad, and roasted Brussels sprout. Hands down.
author: Sheren H.

description:
A little disappointing given the rave reviews.  I would say that this place is average.

The food was ok.  It was a little pricey.  Our meals for the 3 of us were more than $10 each and we were still hungry a few hours later (one of the guys from my party actually just went to eat at another restaurant shortly after this meal).  But you do pick your own portions since you can tell them if you want more of anything.  I've had healthy food that tastes better and is not as expensive.  For the price, it's super casual.  You order at the counter (basically like at a deli) and the food comes out on paper plates.  My lasagna was basically microwaved. 

The employees were nice, but I probably won't come back here.
author: Chantal T.

description: The name says it all :-) lite bite. Convenient fresh, healthy and right up my ally :-)
author: james p.

description: Fab place i loved it! I had the turkey lasagna and the pesto penne noodles and it was super good. Quick, fuss-less place. Mega delicious food.
author: Ella A.

description:
Lite Bite is great if you are looking for something healthy, but also tasty!
And I don't mean pseudo healthy, salad drenched in sauce. I mean healthy with a capital H, clean calories, lean proteins, measured carbs/proteins/fats, the whole shebang. And they don't sacrifice too much flavor while they are doing it. 

After a gym session, I tried the sesame chicken breast with a side of mashed cauliflower and grilled broccoli. My boyfriend went with the chicken salad and the filet kebab. My whole meal was around 350 calories, and I was so full after eating it. I was glad to try mashed cauliflower. I've been hearing it's almost as good as mashed potatoes, but a lot healthier. It tasted really creamy but it wasn't too filling. It was so delicious that I'm actually thinking about making these for thanksgiving sides instead of the potatoes! The broccoli was also really good, and the chicken salad tasted fresh without the mayo drench.

The only gripe I have about this place is that the food is reheated, not made fresh. Therefore, when they heat it up, the meat might not get warmed up enough. However, it's something I'm willing to overlook since good healthy food is so real to come by when eating out. I wish they would expand and open one near my work. Seriously awesome!
author: Julie K.

description: Really liked this place. It's like a deli bar, of all fairly healthy choices. The food tasted great! The salmon was great, as was the kale. Prices seemed fine, a good "lite" dinner will run you $10-$15. Can portion as much or little as you want. Friendly staff and fast service. Will definitely eat here again!
author: Jim S.

description:
What a great way to eat healthy!! 

This is the place to count your calories but actually eat real food! 

You order by weight. Each item is made fresh and can be eaten cold or hot. 

I really liked the chicken enchiladas and the bulgur side. 

They also serve Ritual coffee. 

I definitely will be back especially during the nights when I don't want to cook.
author: Molly T.

description:
I just finished a square of their turkey lasagna and I'm very torn on how to rate it.
The good news is that it was DELICIOUS. Rich and cheesy, with lots of tomato flavor and turkey. It did not taste remotely low in calories. And so I have to say that I'm very dubious about their calorie claims. I just don't see how it's possible that the large serving I just ate was under 400 calories. I microwaved it at home and there was plenty of fat visible in the yummy goo, and the container has plenty of grease stains. 
So... If healthy ingredients and taste are your priorities, by all means get their lasagna. But if you're a serious calorie counter, I'd suggest you be very wary of their numbers. I eat and make enough low calorie food to seriously suspect their claims. But boy was it good! :)
author: Ellen H.

description: Food is good and healthy, but service is painfully slow and inefficient. If you have time, the rating deserves more stars.
author: Ruth C.

description: Delicious! Tons of fresh options! Can't wait to come back and feast :) Today I got the fresh squeezed carrot and coconut juice...so good and cleansing! Feeling better already! Yum!! Lots of healthy options-they also tell you how many "points" each item is worth as well as the nutritional info. Awesome place to eat smart.
author: Kyria E.

description: How have I lived without you these past two years, Lite Bite!?  This is a dream come true for folks struggling to eat right but who don't have the time nor interest to cook healthy food at home. Biggest surprise?  A delectable tray of turkey meatloaf, broccoli, yams, and a sparkling water came out to. $8!?  What a deal!  Will definitely be returning.
author: Andy H.

description: Love the concept of quick healthy food. I had the salmon with cauliflower and my boyfriend had chicken. We liked both. Also really like the healthy smoothies, I got the energizer smoothie and it had a great flavor. I hope they add more healthy dessert.
author: Lauren P.

description: Everytime I'm around that are I try to come over and have my portion of their spinach salad. It's always fresh, very light and super delicious.
author: Asiyat T.

description: Had the turkey lasagna for lunch and it was amazing. Place was clean and tidy only reason why im giving it 3 out 5 of is i wish lady at the register was a bit nicer.A smile wouldnt have hurt and a nicer tone of voice would have made me welcomed as a customer.
author: Lizz C.

description:
I really wish there were more of these in the city. Everything is delicious and low calorie and high in nutritional value. There's a case of different foods you choose from and they charge by weight so you can customize your plate.  With the case of lasagna or polenta pieces etc. they charge by the piece. 

I love the cauliflower, the asian tofu, and the polenta. They also have a side case with their foods pre-packaged so you can take them home. My only critique is that it gets kind of long when they weigh each item separately, they should do more of a standardized portion method like Lemonade in LA. I've never been here when it was very busy but if it were, then this would be a definite time bottleneck. 

The ambiance is lovely. It's on a corner and full of light, feels quaint and fresh and makes you want to go on a juice cleanse for your other meals and start doing pilates and generally lead an overall healthier lifestyle. I look forward to eating here whenever in the Marina and need a quick bite.
author: Carolyn A.

description:
Love this place! Of the three or so times I have been in, the service is also prompt, knowledgeable and friendly. In fact, the tell me what goes into the dish and suggest that I try a sample. 

Just moments ago I finished the Turkey Shepherds Pie, 362 calories of filling deliciousness. When I was purchasing it the man assisting me mentioned that they kept the calories low by making the 'mashed potatoes' out of mushrooms. So good! They had more flavor than regular mashed potatoes... which just taste like whatever fatty topping you pour on top. 

I can't wait to go back and try the enchiladas.
author: Janell H.

description: This was my 1st. Time in last week, I was so impressed with the healthy options, very delicious. The staff was so friendly, a lady who introduced herself to me her name was Mary she had a beautiful smile and was so pleasant. I look forward to coming back and trying something new.
author: Bill N.

description:
Interested concept but I'm not too much into the calorie count craze, nor did I enjoy my microwave heated-lasagna.

It was a cold day and I was just hoping to grab some food nearby. I had no idea this place was most geared towards takeout so I was pretty annoyed that my turkey lasagna was just reheated in the microwave. It didn't seem like they made much effort to warm it up because it was still cold afterwards :/ 

The lasagna itself was okay, it didn't taste amazing like other Yelpers have mentioned. It tasted like normal lasagna but it was lighter tasting than most. It definitely had less cream and not much cheese.

Their nice service doesn't really make up for the fact that their "dine-in" experience is lacking. I get that they're primarily a to-go/quick bite kinda joint but if they've got chairs and tables, they should at least attempt it make a decent experience.

I did like the vanilla bean soda I bought on the side though.
author: Vinky I.

description:
- Yum. Truffled whole wheat pasta was so good, I'm going back to get a pound so I can put it in my fridge. Broccoli rabe with lemon was also fantastic.

- Love the calorie counts.

- Clean.

- Attentive service.

Even better, it's a block away from my apartment and on the way home from the gym!
author: Jeena C.

description:
This place consistently churns out amazing yet healthy stuff. Great staff! Reasonable prices!

Win win!
author: Robert M.

description:
This is an interesting one. Lite Bite is like eating in your own kitchen that is filled with healthy options that are all cold and need to be re-heated in a microwave, so it's really like eating leftovers :). Does that not sound amazing :)?

I would never travel large distances to go here. I wouldn't move mountains to get my last meal here either. With all of that said, this place fills a void on Union Street of healthy and quick option, nothing else on Union fills that void, not one other place. Think about it... 

Anyways, my go to is the salmon w/ chickpeas and olives. I love olives, so all olive dishes in my life are given the "olive bump". It's like the colbert bump, but without the millions of people in the audience watching :). 

Anyways, I recommend Lite Bite for quick eats on Union, especially after working out at Crunch across the street.
author: Michael S.

description: Everytime I'm in cow hollow, this is a required stop for me. I've been here dozens of times and have never had bad food or bad service. All of the food is exceptional, a couple of my favorites: the mint chip smoothie and the turkey stuffed bell peppers. Yum!! And you can order via postmates or grubhub, awesome. There are not enough take out places like this that serve healthy food. I hope they open more locations!
author: Tracy B.

description: Have you ever feel guilty after taking all the high calories yummy food? Are you a weight watcher? Whichever of those, you should pay a visit to this restaurant right at the corner. They serve wonderful, tasty, healthy and low calories food. I simply love their mashed cauliflower. Everything you are going to put into your mouth is so natural. I will visit this more often when I go to SF again.
author: George W.

description:
Lite Bite is my go-to for delicious and healthy eats, daily! The staff/team there are like a family and I'm always happy to be greeted by them.
And, I'm beyond grateful for their array of fresh choices to select from - the beautiful, bright colors of pure, wholesome food nourish me before I even open my mouth!
The food is extremely satisfying on multiple levels, starting with its delectable goodness topped off by knowing I'm doing right by my body. Fantastic all around!
Thank you for delicious health, Lite Bite!
author: Vivien M.

description:
Pros: 
-Great, healthy food.  (If you're like me and you respond to "What should we have for dinner?" with "I don't know...something healthy", then this is your new go-to place.)
-Good service.  (The owner is in there 9 times out of ten.)
-Excellent prices for SF.  (Dinner for 2 for $25?  Awesome.)

Cons:
-You'll pretty much see the same food offerings every time you come in, so it could get tedious if you go a lot...like I do.
author: K R.

description:
I don't ever feel guilty about eating, because I'm a human, and I'm supposed to eat. Food makes me happy. 

And as for YOU (yes you), you are beautiful just the way you are. Gorgeous, in fact. When you eat, you're only more radiant. I hope you get something really nice to eat, somewhere that has a really friendly attitude, and you just enjoy the shit out of it. And then laugh about something wholesome and silly. Life's too short to constantly worry about how you measure up.

I thought the lasagna was bland, bland, bland. Should have trusted my gut instinct (pun unintended, but appreciated)! Lasagna is one food that just shouldn't be effed with. Buckwheat pancakes are one thing. Whole wheat pasta? What'samattahyou??

Zero stars.
author: Martina R.

description:
**Update 7/20/12**

I wrote sort of a tough review of this business and am happy to update my rating as 2 of 3 of the main issues I had have been addressed.  Clearly the owner really cares about his business and that shows in the effort he puts out every day.  I wish they had a few bread options and a bit more for breakfast, but all in all happy to see this place doing well offering healthy food.



Writing this with the strong hope that the owner reads it because I'm really rooting for this guy and his concept for healthy food to go.  First off the food they make is really good and healthy, which is awesome.  But it takes incredibly long to get your food and there are some really annoying quirks about how this place is run.  A few quick tweaks and the customer experience would be a million times better.

ridiculous issue #1 - weighing and pricing every piece of food on your plate separately.  All the prices are within two dollars, why not just make it all the same price and just weigh each plate at the end?  The way they do it now takes soooooo long it is absurd.  If there is anyone in the store I won't go in because I know it will take forever.

#2 - they have one microwave.  please go to costco and get one more microwave.  Same deal as with #1, if there is anyone else in line then everything just takes so much longer because there is a line to reheat your plate.  This one is ridiculously easy.

#3 - why do they hide the forks and knives? No one is going to start hoarding these things if you put them next to the napkins on the counter so you don't have to grab someone behind the counter and ask them to get you utensils.  I get that they don't want to create extra waste, but who's going to take more then one fork? 

Again, the food is really tasty and healthy (and they put the nutritional info on the labels which is nice).  Just need to figure out a couple of issues related to the service and they'll be rockin....
author: Michael N.

description: I was really impressed by the place, concept and frankly the look of the place and went in for lunch. Honestly the food was tasteless and my husband ended the day with a bad stomach!!! Chicken enchiladas was his choice.. :( the spinach lasagna was tasteless! Would never go back on there.
author: Sumitha P.

description:
This is a long and much needed addition to Union Street. For years I have asked--when Chestnut and other streets have so many fast healthy options--where can I have a quick healthy bite on Union Street? A "lite bite," perhaps? 

Finally I found an answer, and I am hooked. I think I ate here three times last week (at the physical location), but that doesn't count the take out/grocery items I've been snacking on every single day from this place. It's like my new Trader Joe's prepared foods section, but healthier, with more transparency on nutritional info, and frankly--better!

Here are some favorites:
Cauliflower chickpea - you have to try this, it has a little kick to it
Whole wheat lasagna - healthy lasagna! can you believe it? goes great with the...
Turkey meatballs - oh, how I miss meatballs
Quinoa with various flavors - how can you say no to quinoa?

Very friendly owner / manager who can talk you through his business, why he's passionate about it, and where they are headed!
author: Mike G.

description:
On one hand, how good can you expect microwaved broccoli to be? 
On the other hand, had a reasonably healthy lunch for under $10
author: Lonnie E.

description: Maybe harsh, BUT anyone charging almost $3 for a cup of coffee that's not fresh, tastes watered down and more like tea should NOT be allowed to sell COFFEE! I made my unhappiness abundantly clear, to the pretentious server who aside from an uptight attitude offered nothing. So, I left the cup of ? on the counter. I'll give them less than 6 mo before they close their doors with that kind of service.
author: Valorie L.

description:
wonderful wonderful place! 

i love that the place is spacious and bright.  food is displayed kind of like at a super market so you can choose what you want.

i got the quinoa, moroccan spicy chicken and beets.  everything was so fresh and although i ate a lot, i did not feel weighed down.  chicken was perfect - not too dry despite having just been heated in the oven.

the (asian) broccoli was SO good, too.  it's sour and not like normal broccoli, but the flavor is natural.  my friend ordered that and the turkey meatballs which were so tasty too.
