service is fabulous.  i don't know if it was the owner who was helping us, but he seemed to know a lot about the food.  he warned us about the flavors of what we ordered to make sure we knew what kind of food we wanted.  i don't know... he was great :)  made us feel like we were eating at a friend's house or something.

pomegranate tea was yums too.  i want to come back!!

oh.. forgot to add... this place was cheap!!  looking at the price per pounds on the displays made it look expensive, but really cheap.  well worth it!!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Mmmmmmm Lite Bite. I went for a first time lunch yesterday and absolutely loved it. The concept: upscale-ish healthy but delicious food presented in sort of a deli-like selection. AKA you can select a protein (salmon, chicken, beef skewers, turkey meatballs, and more) and then various salads (roasted yams, cauliflower & chickpeas, polenta & chicken salad, more and more) and get it all on a plate that is weighed. I had all of the above salads with salmon (came with a delectable dollop of pea puree on top) and fully enjoyed it. It's the perfect place to pop in, get a quick healthy and delicious lunch. I also had a cookie, not sure what it was, but it was delish as well. 

Only reason I didn't give it five stars is because it's no unique culinary masterpiece of a place -- just straight up good healthy food. I'm sure you could make everything there at home, but it's great for when you don't want to make that much of an effort to get a good meal. I'll definitely be back for more!
author: Elena K.

description: Wow! Just put an order in for pick up and I'm now in love. This is seriously so good. The food is healthy and love how they display all the calories and nutrition value. I think I may end up ordering here a lot.... Which is bad news for my wallet but good news for my body. Ha. They have online ordering via yelp and eat24 but just call and order it's cheaper and they have much more of a selection. Great place. Check it out if you want tasty healthy food options.
author: Jess O.

description: Nicest people ever, great selection of low cal yet tasty and filling meals that are a healthy alternative to store bought processed meals. Great concept for those that don't have time to cook something healthy or travel a lot. Just take home, heat and eat!
author: Natasha C.

description: What a delightful addition to Union St. High quality ingredients, some organic, mostly natural, but otherwise conscious food by the weight. Simply excellent and the chocolate pudding is divine!  I have never tasted anything like it  and I keep coming back. I want to buy buckets of it. Worth checking it out.
author: Claudia B.

description: This place wasn't what I expected.  The food was ok, and the service was very friendly, but it was very expensive for what we got. Also, it was sweltering inside (I realize it has been unseasonably warm) but seriously.
author: Marie D.

description:
I was debating between giving this place 4 or 5 stars, but then my liver whispered, "5 starrssssss."

After a weekend of binge-eating Sara P.'s delicious homemade oatmeal-chocolate-chip cookies (I mean it when I say "binge" and "delicious"), it was time to crack down.  Having arrived a few minutes early for my wax appointment at Bare, I decided to pick up a quick lunch at Lite Bite.

It's sort of like sensory (at least visual) overload, because it's sort of like the deli section of a grocery store.  Salmon, turkey meatloaf, various sides, etc.  There's also a refrigerated section for pre-packaged salads, sandwiches (I saw these mini bagel sandwiches with salmon), and drinks.

Not wanting to take up too much time to just select food, I opted for some quinoa with corn and jalapenos, and their herb-roasted potatoes, and from the fridge I grabbed an aloe drink.  It came out to be a sub-$10 meal; you pay per oz. so you can get as much or as little of something as you want (the different items are differently priced, so it's not like Lee's Deli or anything where everything goes into one tray).

The amount of food I had was a perfect light lunch; I wasn't too big a fan of the herb-roasted potatoes cold, but I loved the quinoa.  The corn and jalapenos gave it a nice texture and flavor, and it's something I'll definitely be ordering again.  After seeing all the reviews for the turkey meatloaf, it's next on my to-try list.  The best part is that it's on my way home from work, so I can always stop by to pick up dinner and not feel guilty about it.

I think this justifies having another cookie right now.
author: Tori S.

description:
very nice place...it's healthy, you can eat as little as you want...so no huge portions that you have to pay for....I mean the name says it all....lite bite...right?....so it was supposed to be NOT heavy greasy, with cheese and other additions place...
I like it....not everyday but definitely often....
author: Alex W.

description:
So this place is pretty much the same concept as the to-go pre-made dishes at Whole Foods and other health markets.  I like the concept but I wasn't blown away.  I would rather go to Whole Foods and have a wider selection.  The food was good and they let you try everything so that is nice but for the price I wasn't that impressed.  I had the eggplant salad and the asian tofu salad.  Both were flavorful but for a 1/2 pint of each it cost me $10.  They do fill it up quite a bit but I was surprised by the cost.  

The decor is very plain and gives it a bit of a stark cafeteria feel.  To stay and eat inside felt a bit weird so i opted to take my food to go and find a bench on the street.  I probably wouldn't go back unless they made the environment more fun and more options for sizing so price could be less.
author: Carrie H.

description: Very tasty casual and fast. Good job owners.
author: Jason H.

description:
The service was excellent and it was nice that the owner (I assume) tried to walk us carefully and patiently through the menu despite how busy he was.  I saw him rush to politely clean tabletops for other customers as they sat down in spots that were recently vacated by others.  

We both enjoyed our food very much-- an enchilada with quinoa and a chicken roast pepper sandwich.  I ordered pomegranate ice tea and was informed that I can get free refills. (it was delicious).  Wife feels it is noteworthy that I mention that if the dish you order is available in the fridge (recently made) then they will heat it for you rather than make it on the spot.  If it is not there then they are happy to make it.

Would return often if I lived nearby.
author: Eric E.

description:
I gained how much weight from Thanksgiving?!? What the??? What am I going to eat for lunch this week? What am I going to eat in the month of December? I still have all these holiday parties and lots of cake and fatty, cholesterol laden meats  to eat.... WHAT AM I GOING TO DO?

Yes, I sound like a cheesy commercial. Yes, I sound like an overly concerned pansy worried about weight. Yes, I actually said the above to myself on Monday and realized I sounded like a cheesy pansy. In the end this cheesy pansy needed to search for some lunchtime food to strike a balance with the mounds of holiday food both already consumed and soon to be consumed. 

Enter Lite Bite on Union Street...

Lite Bite is a new shop on Union Street that focuses on serving delicious yet very healthy meals. The niche here is they make it a point to provide detailed nutritional information on every item. They concentrate on sourcing quality ingredients to derive the great flavors. Fresh herbs, spices, and healthy oils are used to season and cook as to not add on extra calories. What does that get you? Here's an example of a favorite meal of mine...

6oz. Salmon - 271 cal - Atlantic Salmon with simply kosher salt and black pepper. Tasty as is (as it should be), but great the included pea puree.

5oz. Quinoa w/ Corn & Jalapeno - 180 cal - Tasty quinoa kicked up with jalapeno balanced with the sweetness of corn.

4oz. Broccoli Rabe - 50 cal - Broccoli rabe sauteed in e.v.o.o., garlic, red pepper flakes, and lemon zest.

Total count: 501 cal for 15oz. of tasty food. 

So I'm not that much of a calorie counter even though it seems like it in this post. But that's just the deal with Lite Bite. They do it for you. They're pretty meticulous about it. I saw an employee measure out salt on a digital food scale to add in prepping the roasted carrots (and removed pinch). The only minus is that the food is served chilled, but they can warm it up for you. As for me, always eat the food as is chilled and it's delicious.

And again, I must say 501 calories for nearly a pound of tasty, healthy, fresh food. Can you beat that?!?
author: Al L.

description:
I work on Union St., and there aren't that many placed to grab a quick bite without overpaying for it.
I'm glad Lite Bite opened!  They have delicious healthy foods.  I believe the owner works there as well, and he provides wonderful customer service.  He'd talk to you about what it is that you're getting and what's good in it for you/why you'd like it.
Even though they're not completely opened yet and don't do all the things they want to do, Lite Bite has great potential.
Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Dasha B.

description:
I keep wanting to call this place Lite-Brite, but that dates me like tennis shoe roller skates and a Joanie Loves Chachi poster. 

Lite Bite's food is reasonably priced, healthy, and indulgent. Those three things are rarely found under one roof and I really commend the owners for getting it right. Everything I've tried thus far has been delicious, especially the turkey meatballs, chicken enchiladas, and roasted carrots. 

I love them for giving me a neighborhood take out option that feels like a luxury, but is actually a bargain (calorically *and* financially speaking).
author: Quinn B.

description:
As a personal trainer with a studio just up the street from this new and wonderful addition to the neighborhood, I feel like my prayers have been answered...healthy, delicious, low calorie meals prepared with high quality ingredients and served up by the friendly and affable owners.  And they have vegan options.

AND GREAT COFFEE!!! Yes folks, Union street finally has some good coffee. 
Now when my clients complain that it is too hard to eat healthy unless you cook all the time, I can just send them 2 blocks down to Lite Bite.  Of course I myself will be going back for the healthy food and the deliciously brewed Ritual Coffee.
author: Nilu r.

description: I had the turkey lasagna and I thought it was a bit too sweet for my taste. I also has the crab cake and that too did not taste that great. My friend tried the sesame chicken and a kale salad mixed with yam which I tried and thought was quite good. Some items here definitely taste better than others (and you can get samples before choosing) but I definitely do think it is a bit too pricey for the amount.
author: A. O.

description: Hmm...I'm not quiet sure what's so good about this place. I came in on a Sunday to grab a quick bite to go. I was excited to see what they had to offer. Unfortunately, there wasn't much. Whole foods has more to offer than this place. I got a crab cake, kale salad& cauliflower mash which cost me $20. Holy moly. That's really expensive. For that price, I can feed two people! The portion size was really small. It was in these circular tiny containers. I don't think I would come back again.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Lite Bite's motto: all-natural, fresh, low-calorie ingredients to create lighter, nutritious offerings that don't compromise on taste. 

With the encouragement of the very friendly owner, I was able to sample the beets, apricot couscous, quinoa salad, lentil salad and turkey meatloaf. Everything was pretty good.  The couscous and quinoa tasted like salads that I've prepared at home so  I ended up with the lentil salad and turkey meatloaf. The lentil salad was earthy and woodsy. The turkey meatloaf was really moist and flavorful despite its low fat content. I enjoyed my healthy, light dinner so much that I bought more turkey meatloaf for lunch the next day.  

The price of my meal was also very reasonable. For the smallest container of lentil salad and two slices of turkey meatloaf, I spent about $8. Not bad for two healthy, tasty meals. 

I wandered into Lite Bite not knowing what it was, but it has potential to be popular. They are currently operating at 40-50% of their full menu offerings. I look forward to updating my review once I'm able to try more of Lite Bite's menu.
author: Monelle A.

description:
Walk in, choose what you want from the glass case, super nice staff weighs it and super healthy you pays. Super easy. 
Cauliflower mash was a little bland but a cool new idea, totally gonna steal it. 
There's no way that deliciousness they call chicken enchilada was only 270some calories. It was cheesy, filling, delicious. And it says 2 pieces was one serving?? I don't think the cal count was accurate, but that was one damn good meal. Sparkling blueberry water to wash it all down, total = $8.40.  Pretty darn good.
author: Christine Y.

description:
My partner and I tried this place 2 Saturdays ago during the Union Street Fair.  As we were going through the area, the aromas from the food vendors were intoxicating and were making us more and more famished.  However, because we are trying to eat better, we decided to pass on the evil temptations and slip in to this cute shop instead.  Right away, we were greeted very warmly and samples were offered.  I decided on the turkey meatloaf and a side of tofu salad and green beans.  The meatloaf was a very good rendition of the dish.  It has a lot of flavors and is very moist.  The tofu salad is also very tasty.  The green beans that were there were seemingly past their prime so are not a crunchy as I had hoped.  Otherwise, the flavor is also there.  My partner also greatly enjoyed her chicken drumstick and side of sweet potato.  

I have since been back for takeout.  The service and food quality has been consistent, much to our joy.  We'll certainly be back for more!
author: Yvette F.

description:
I walked into Lite Bite to get a cup of coffee, assuming it was yet another snooty, over-priced, mediocre Union Street rip off. Plus, I had to wee, and I hate the dirty looks I always get when I wee in the customer only bathroom when all I get is a small coffee.

Well.

This man behind the counter was so nice. I mean, like extra-midwestern nice (I lived in the midwest for 5 years, so it's OK for me to say that) I ended up getting the grilled vegetable sandwich, it was small, but for under $5 really almost a deal. The super nice counter man heated it up for me-and holy moley was it delish! I mean, like it was so good I wanted to moosh it all up in my face! I love my meat so it takes a lot for me to appreciate a sammy without, but the veggies were cooked perfectly and there was just the perfect amount of creamy rondele cheese and some sort of herbiness that I couldn't put my finger on but that I kind of worshiped. Plus the bread was fresh and nice without being to bready.

Oh-and the coffee was perfect.

I'm so going to start getting my lazy but out of the sunset for this place.
author: Ellen S.

description:
Stumbled upon this by accident and found it a pleasant surprise!
Very flavorful, reasonably priced, healthy food! Amazing. Loved it!
author: Verna L.

description: DELICIOUS, healthy food. Simple ingredients but sooo much flavor. I had the spinach lasagna w/ yams and it was just the right amount. Will definitely come back to try some of their other dishes!
author: Mel B.

description:
I LOVE this place!  I'm vegetarian, my husband is not, so it's a little tricky when picking a place to eat at.  But this place has SO many options.  There are at least 8 meat/fish options for him and at least 10 veggie options for me.  You can't beat that.  

The food is so fresh... you can tell it's good quality food.  No yucky preservative after taste.  You know you're putting gooood food into your body.  

And the taste!... everything's delicious.  Plus they let you try any of the sides.

And lastly, it's very reasonably priced.  When I bring home a meal for my husband (one meat, one side dish), it comes to under $7-8.  That's a steal and way better than any restaurant's take out.  

When you want a good dinner but don't want to deal with a restaurant, this is a great option.  To top it all off, the folks who work there are super nice and if you get the owner/chef, he can tell you all about the food (the ingredients, how it's prepared...).  

P.s. Don't be fooled by it looking empty.  I think most folks take their food to go, so peeps are constantly in and out of there.

Give it a try.  You won't regret it!
author: Elena I.

description:
Full disclosure.

Ingredient list. Calorie count. This country wouldn't have such an obesity problem if more restaurants followed Lite Bite's lead and provided this information. You know exactly what you are eating. Being better informed usually means better decisions.

From multiple visits:

- Turkey meatballs with organic tomato sauces and whole wheat bread crumbs made an excellent addition to my whole wheat pasta

- Grilled veggie sandwich featuring squash, eggplant, lowfat cheese and sundried tomatoes was exceptional

- Egg and cheese sandwich was everything a McMuffin isn't. Organic egg, lowfat cheese and a whole wheat muffin. I'd argue it's much better. 

- Bundt cake was the perfect sinless finale

Lite Bite proves being healthy can also be delicious.
author: Jason B.

description:
A cute little place to grab a quick and healthy lunch. I came back from a workout and got the chicken breast and kale salad. It was good and filling and let's not forget healthy :) 

Staff was polite and nice. My total price was around $6, which is not bad for a filling lunch. Next time, I think I'll try the salmon. They even have little meal boxes to take home. I like that they have the calorie count as well.
author: Jasmine W.

description:
This place is great!  You order a la cart by weight, the food is healthy, tastes great and the prices are good.

Turkey meatloaf - I have had my share of turkey meatloaf (my mom makes one) and I gotta say this is pretty good.  Hmmm... may its the mean.  They sell it and its on the regular menu!

Eggplant parmigiana - pretty tasty.

Roasted organic yams - really good and my toddler loved them.

Quinoa - pretty good.  They cook it with some spice that I don't recall because I tasted different grains they were serving and heard too many descriptions in a short time.

When I find myself in the neighborhood again I will likely be picking up something here.
author: Jon C.

description:
Affordable, healthy food is hard to find.  When I'm eating healthy, I always cook/make it myself since most places add tons of oil, butter, etc, to make their food taste good.

There are so many great options.  I love the turkey meatloaf, turkey meatballs, lasagna, salmon with pea puree, and grilled chicken.  The mini fig and prosciutto sandwich is tasty too, I was starving and ate it on the street while I walked home (like a savage animal).

I also love their side dishes.  I love the tofu salad which has such a nice dressing to it and I don't even like tofu but love it here.  The chicken/polenta salad and cauliflower salad are great too.  

I typically spend about $8 per meal.  So affordable.  Sometimes I buy the pre-packaged meals and take it to work for lunch the next day.  So much healthier & tastier than anything near my work.

I seriously love this place.  Perfect if you want to eat healthy or if you are trying to lose weight.  After eating here, I always feel like I did something good for my body.
author: Shelly W.

description: Lite bite is amazing! A healthy restaurant that is DELICIOUS. Lite bite has taken great food and cut the calories in half without diminishing the great tastes. The smoothies are to die for. Every food item listed has calorie count along with fat content, sodium percentage, and other nutritional information. More restaurants need this. GO HERE FOR SURE.
author: Madison D.

description: Lite Bite is significantly better than Square Meals. That is all.
author: Alex L.

description:
Still a fan!

Had the enchiladas and cous cous with apricot.

DELISH!!!
author: Vince S.

description:
So refresing to finally get a place on Union Street that caters to our health and pocketbook (and NOT our propensity for drink). 

Blown away by the salads, the soothing, sunlit interiors, and the honesty of the concept. (Just wish the food were a tad more spicy.)
author: Leah B.

description: Amazing, amazing, amazing!!!!  We opened an office on Union street and get our company lunches here almost everyday.  Nice simple healthy dishes that we would never have the time to make on our own.
author: Lance C.

description:
This place is amazing and an answer to my prayers! I work long hours and don't have time to cook but still want to eat yummy healthy food. This has always been a challenge. I used to go to whole foods but it's so expensive. For $8 I picked up a ready to go meal of turkey meatloaf and cauliflower mash potatoes Soooo yummy. Best part they list the calories and this meal came to less than 450 calories and it was a large portion!
Also had the pea soup, roasted carrots, enchiladas, roasted potatoes, and lentil salad. Everything tasted amazing I wanted to buy the whole market! This place is must go :)
author: Mariana S.

description:
Five stars for being the healthiest place on Chestnut Street.  Everything is fresh, delicious and prices are reasonable considering the quality.  Interior is clean and basic and the tables make good use of small size.  

They'll keep the five stars if they can expand their menu a bit and put their daily entrees online.
author: T H.

description:
Fantastic idea.  I want to eat healthier but not sure how, and on top of it all I'm seriously picky about flavor.  I don't want to sacrifice.  I also eat meat, unapologetically.   Lite Bite did a great job on my turkey lasagne, which left me satisfied but not sleepy or bloated and my grilled veggies, which I chose to eat cold were a fantastic option. Love the free refills on mighty leaf iced tea, two varieties without caffeine.  

We'll be back.  Great option for a quick dinner and fairly priced.  As a serious home cook I know how much work it takes to source quality organic ingredients, test recipes, and prepare food this tasty and healthy at the same time.   And it's the same price as ordering an extra large pizza.  think about that next time you pick up the phone.
author: Mel B.

description: I'm obsessed! I've been eating here for the past 6 months and I leave satisfied every time. Extremely healthy but very delicious. Definitely try the sesame chicken, turkey meatballs, kale salad, carrots and broccoli. The staff is super friendly as well...
author: Michael A.

description: Great selection of healthy meal options . Always such friendly service ! Absolutely love Moroccan chicken there! Great place to pick a healthy option on the go!
author: Julie B.

description:
Love this place.  Fresh, healthy food options and a very friendly and knowledgable staff.  Whether coming in for a snack (as I now do almost daily) or for a full meal, this is the place!  Highly recommend to those in the neighborhood.

Cauliflower and chickpea salad is amazing!
author: Howard S.

description: The chicken mole pie was incredible.  Smoothies also incredible.   This owner puts a lot of love into her menu
author: Thomas H.

description: Lite Bite is really good! Fresh/ healthy food choices--the name doesn't lie ;). Very clean space, super friendly staff & the food was awesome. The butternut squash soup was really creamy & vegan! Yum. Great place to grab lunch or dinner :-) Thanks for healthy food options on Union Street! I'll be back soon.
author: LB D.

description: I love this place! I wish they had one in San Jose. I love coming here when Im on a diet because all their food is low in calories. ^__^ The place is hard to find because it's very small so just keep your eyes open, they're on the corner of the street. Parking is a big hassle, but I am def. coming back here again when I'm back in town. (:
author: Thuy L.

description: I like this place, but it's really intimidating /odd to be asked how many pieces of tomatoes you want. If I admit I wanted like 8 slices of small lightly seasoned pieces am I weird? I got ONE mid sized portobella mushroom and 4 slices of tomatoes with a basil-ish sauce. It was good and contrary to someone who said it was overpriced my meal came out to less than 5 bucks . For the Marina I found that to be outstanding. Very nice service. Not quite sure about the portion monitoring that they build their pricing and meals on but whatever. It was good
author: Lauren V.

description:
Yum! Delicious and low calories...amazing. There are few grab and go places on Union Street so I am thrilled that Lite Bite is here. The selection is great and the food always tastes fresh, healthy, and not overfilling. Great option for lunch, and snag an extra meal for dinner. 
My only wish is that you would change up the menu and add new items to the selections - I would definitely go more often.
author: Su R.

description: Had turkey meat loaf couscous and yams for lunch and it was excellent.  Love the fact that all utensils are compostable. Staff was very friendly and it was great to get fast healthy food.
author: Anthony N.

description: Everything is freshly made for the day...the earlier you arrive the better chances you will have of trying anything they cool...they run out of food towards the end of the day...because it is that GOOD!!
author: Paolo E.

description: Great light meals to go or for here. Priced right and real calorie information with lots of options for a healthy meal.
author: Heather W.

description:
I love this place.  Don't let the "healthy food" restaurant fool you.  Their food tastes great AND is healthy.  My favorites are the moroccan chicken, turkey meatloaf, turkey lasagne, and the green beans

And the food is very inexpensive.  All of my meals have been between $8-$12.
author: Joe S.

description: Great smoothies. Food is good. All of which is overpriced and they general don't accommodate much when you want a little sauce to go with your unmarinated steak. I will also add that they purposely do not fill up your smoothie cup despite the left overs in the blender. Now that's just weird.
author: Jason W.

description: Owner was very personable and says he's looking to open another site in Financial District in the next year. I was pushing for Soma and Mission Bay so we'll see.  His team let me try a lot of the sides before buying which was nice.
author: Patricia A.

description:
This place is amazing, I am so glad they opened up.  I have lunch here multiple times every week, and I am never disappointed.  Everything has ingredients and calories listed, and everything is extremely healthy, low-fat, whole-wheat, and organic when possible.

Mary's Organic Chicken Breast, delicious, extremely healthy, and can be paired well with the mashed cauliflower, eggplant salad, broccolini, tofu salad, and/or grilled vegetables.  The grilled vegetables are amazing and include options, portobello mushrooms are my favorite, they also have eggplant, zucchini, onions, etc.  You can choose how much of everything you want, and you can take it to go our eat it there.

There is also a pre-made food section if you're in a hurry, these sandwiches and salads are also wonderful, and also list all ingredients and caloric information.

The lasagna features whole wheat pasta and low-fat mozzarella, the chicken enchiladas have organic chicken, low fat cheese, etc.  Everything is to die for!!  This is how I cook these at home, and to have someone else doing the work for you, but without the guilt that you usually experience when eating out (full-fat cheeses, white breads and pastas, heavy cream and butter)  -- winning combination!!!

This place is such a gem, it is the most reasonably-priced restaurant in the area, and by far the healthiest and most informative!
author: Katie A.

description:
After walking by Lite Bite multiple times since they've opened, I finally decided to stop in tonight to see what it's all about.  I have come away both very pleased, and very disappointed.  Pleased with absolutely everything about my experience, and disappointed in myself for having walked by so many times without going in :(

First off, the food.  I ordered the grilled moroccan chicken and the green beans with shallots and red pepper flakes.  While boxing up my chicken, the very nice gentleman behind the counter also threw in a piece of yam, telling me that it was an excellent accompaniment to the chicken. Now, I have never been a fan of yam, so I didn't really have high hopes for that one.  Let me say though, Nice Man Behind the Counter, you have made a believer out of me!  The chicken was perfectly seasoned with a bit of a kick that was perfectly matched with the sweetness of the yam.  Both the chicken and the yam were well cooked as well, the chicken still being moist and tender and the yam soft without being too mushy.  The green beans were amazing as well!  I love the spiciness of the red pepper flakes with the clean crunch of the green beans (which were also cooked to perfection!)

The service was also a solid 5 at Lite Bite.  The gentleman helping me was very friendly and knowledgeable about the different foods both what went well together (the yam!!) and how they were each prepared.  Also, even when it got busy behind me, I didn't feel like he got frantic or rushed, but was still very pleasant to myself and the people waiting.

Now, there are a lot of places in the city that have both great food and excellent service, but to eat at a lot of those places you'd be looking at weeks of top ramen afterwards just to be able to continue paying your rent.  Not Lite Bite though!  For my healthy and low-cal plate of filling deliciousness, I was set back a mere $4.  Four Dollars!!  I don't even think I could cook it for that cheap....

tl;dr Food is tasty, healthy, and filling, service is excellent, and your wallet will love you.
author: Nicole N.

description: I've been here for lunch a couple times, and it's a nice little spot.  My biggest complaint is that they are quite pricey for what it is.  I like the focus on healthy foods, and I'm certainly impressed by their attempt to educate the consumer on the benefits of things like brown rice.  The things I've had have all been fairly good, considering they were sitting out for a while and then microwaved.  If they halved their prices, this would be a fantastic spot, but a $13-15 lunch that is equivalent to bringing in my own leftovers and then microwaving them seems very steep.
author: Yan L.

description: Had the lasagna. I agree it's quite healthy and affordable but the quality was not ate there even at the price points. I empathize some on price because of location. Although I'm not a fan, the concept works within the walls of cow hollow.
author: Nelson C.

description: Love this place!  The turkey lasagna and chicken enchiladas are our favorites - absolutely delicious, fill us up and don't make us feel bloated or gross after.  I also highly recommend the turkey meat loaf with the mashed cauliflower - delicious!  I love the broccoli, which I eat cold, and the yams and grilled veggies are fantastic.  I find the price to be just fine considering how much I would spend at the grocery store only to toss half of what I bought.  We eat here at least 4 night a week - super easy to grab something after the gym.
author: Deborah H.

description: The food was amazing and so were the people. I was afraid I would never find a place like Lite Bite and I have. I am in love! Healthy eating for healthy living.
author: Lakeisha N.

description: Very healthy food. I like how they post the calories on most of their food. We took some food to go. The salmon was very fresh and not fishy at all. I liked their turkey meatballs in the tomato sauce. They have entrees to go which seem like a good option for lunch.
author: Natalie S.

description: Quick, fast, easy, great customer service. The perfect place to get fresh, healthy grub on the go.
author: Keira R.

description:
If you are trying to be healthy, Lite Bite is a great option.  They have good pre-packed items (Asian chicken salad is my fave) or you can order what you want from the counter.  If you are following a diet program, they list all the ingredients, calories, and other nutritional info.  They even show the weight watchers points. The food is tasty considering it's healthy.  The turkey meatballs and the cauliflower and olives mix are particularly delicious.  

Opportunities for improvement: add more food variety or add specials.  They offer the same items at the counter everyday so it gets a little boring.  

This is the place for casual, healthy eating- take out or dine in.  It is not a magical culinary experience, though, so don't expect that. It is hard to make low cal food taste awesome, but they make a good effort.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I love that I can come here and eat without worrying about the tons of oil and butter that a chef threw into my seemingly-healthy dish. Everything is fresh, healthy, yummy, and the place is super clean!

Love the spiced chicken, salmon with sauce, grilled veggies, truffled pasta, and salads. Perfect place to pick up lunch/ dinner for the week!
author: Sandra H.

description: Awesome fresh low cal - high nutrient food. Friendly and helpful staff and the owner is great. The place is well run, clean and professional. Very reasonable prices too.
author: Chum E.

description: After a workout and not quite lunch ready, popped in here to grab a bite to tie me over until then. Ordered some eggplant salad and thought it was delicious (some spices, eggplant, tomatoes and onion). A bit pricey but better than eating a bag o chips to me. Also nice (or could be bad depending on your pov) how they put the calorie count next to the item. Quick in and out service.
author: Teresa T.

description: Interesting healthy foods.  Like that you can scale your portions to fit your apetite.
author: Mike D.

description: I really love their green smoothies. It's a great replacement for a meal in the mornings and you can see the whole process of them making the smoothie. Fresh ingredients and it keeps your stomach feeling satisfied! I'd recommend it for people who like to be aware of what they eat-
author: Emily P.

description: Just had a meal at Lite Bite and came home to write a review right away!  Lite Bite is an awesome, new concept that does healthy fast food.  Don't let the cold case deter you.  The salmon and bulger salad are super tasty along with everything else I had there.  I spoke with Angelo, the owner, and his passion for nutrition and health really shine through.  I will definitely be making Lite Bite a regular weekly night option.
author: Wendy N.

description:
This is a hard one...

I'm very glad Lite Bite has opened.  It is the perfect addition to the already wonderful array of restaurants here in Cow Hollow.  I go there several times a week and love the food.  In general, their dishes are super tasty and relatively affordable.  They have some very nice pre-prepared salads that they will even toss for you on the spot--a very nice touch.

Here's the downside. The manager is extremely friendly to his customers.  He smiles and treats you well, and then he'll turn to his staff and treat them rudely right in front of you.   I honestly hope he reads this, as it is bad enough that I feel a little guilty even patronizing the place. Dude, we see how you treat you employees.  Clean up your act.  It doesn't really take that much to add a courtesy word ("Please" toss this gentleman's salad) or to make a command polite with a request ("Would you" mind tossing this gentleman's salad?)  He needs to learn that the how he treats is staff in public is at least as  important as how he treats his customers.  If they can fix this, Lite Bite will be awesome--and I bet you'll be able to take the Help Wanted sign down from the window.

I really hope they succeed.
author: Dave B.

description: First time here after having walked past for weeks now... What incredibly nice people behind the counter!  And WHOA, try the Omega smoothie please - it's AMAZING. Definitely going to make this a habit!
author: Genevieve H.

description:
came in confused as to how to order since theres no menu or anything.
but whoever was behind the counter that day was super helpful and explained it to me. 
you can try a sample of a dish before diving in and ordering a whole plateful, which would have been useful had i been told that. 
i ordered cauliflower mash, saute broccoli rabe, and a slice of the whole wheat lasagna with ground turkey. 

lets get right to it. 
-cauliflower mash: 1/5 
to me it was tasteless and an odd grainy texture considering how it wasnt made to a smooth consistency. everytime i had a spoonful i expected mashed potato but instead got cauliflower mash. 
-saute broccoli rabe: 3/5
i was told that the broccoli rabe has a bitter taste so it was recommended to have a squeeze of lime over it. since i didnt try it and therefore didnt know any better, i went with the recommendation. and im glad i did. the lime made it taste much better and i quickly finished the broccoli rabe before i even finished half of the cauliflower mash. shouldve just stuck with broccoli rabe alone but oh well. you win some you lose some.
-whole wheat lasagna: 3/5
an average slice of lasagna if you ask me. but they had a whole sign explaining how their lasagna is better for you because they use ground turkey and yada yada yada. it tastes average but its better for me? wiiiiiiiiin!

overall the food is meh. and throughout the whole meal i wish they had salt and pepper readily available at the tables. 

my advice? sample the dishes before ordering any.
author: Wendy N.

description: Great natural food, we had the salmon with a nice purée of peas, Parmesan, and garlic on top. Cauliflower salad was great too. Friendly staff, open kitchen so you can see preparation of delicious food.  This will become a staple when we're in the marina district.
author: Clay W.

description: I'm pretty particular about what goes in the temple. Lite Bite has the kind of health-conscious, creative, and tasty food I don't always have time or energy to make after a long day. Actually, I think they made this place for me. I mean, they put it on my street. On my bus route, in fact, so I can pick up food on my way home from work. "Bite" even starts with the same letter as my name. This is just too much to be coincidence...
author: Brian T.

description: Lite Bites is a great addition to the neighborhood.  I can get healthy food that is actually good.  Two things you have to try are the grilled chicken breast sandwich and the eggplant parmigiana.  Fast courteous service adds to the experience.
author: Robert G.

description:
Great place to go when you're too lazy/busy to cook a healthy meal.

You can mix and match any of the meats and sides and they'll portion everything out onto a plate (or to-go box) for you.  Everything is charged by weight.

I got the Mary's chicken breast, green beans, and mash cauliflower.  The chicken was on the dry side but that's how I knew it was healthy.  Everything pretty much tasted like how it would come out if I made it for myself, seasoned enough but without excessive use of butter, cheese, etc.
author: S L.

description:
Being short on time, I'll just copy what I posted to FB from Lite Bite last night...

Finally, a healthy prepared dinner for under $10 - whole wheat pasta with truffle oil, arugula, and mushrooms; lean turkey meatballs; and broccoli rabe with lemon. Thank you, Lite Bite on Union Street. This should not be such a rare find. Bonus points for compostable plates and cutlery. Very well done all around.

... and add to my FB status: I would go out of my way to come back here.  I've been looking for healthy takeout/no-frills-eat-in alternatives to Whole Foods at this price point and have found very little.  I wish that Lite Bite closed a bit later than 8, because I work late, go to the gym still later, and don't live in this neighborhood.  I'd need Lite Bite to be open until 10 PM on week nights to patronize it regularly.  But I'm still glad to have discovered it.  I put in a shameless plug to the (very friendly) owner to open a second location in my neighborhood.  If he does, I will definitely become a regular.
author: B L.

description: I'm in here way to much.  Depending on what you get it can be cheap or it can be expensive.  Everything on the menu is delish and they have something for every type of diet (vegetarian, vegan, carnivore, etc.) I for one don't eat red meat and when I first walked in here, Angelo, the owner, explained to me how they work and pointed out all the things I could eat, which was very sweet.  All the girls who work here are dolls.
author: Kelly N.

description: It has taken a while to actually make it in this little spot and now I wonder why?  It is exactly what I have been looking for on Union Street for years!  Tasty, healthy quick and you can eat in or take it home...don't think I will ever cook again?!  This weekend I brought the Black Bean Salad to a BBQ with a bag of chips and it was a hit.  Probably not your kids palate...but I think kids should expand- so bring them and have them eat the enchilada and try the couscous....you never know?!
author: lauren h.

description: It's a very cozy store with a variety of health dishes at affordable price. It shall become my go-to place for a quick health bite.
author: X L.

description: Wow - I am totally shocked after eating a delicious meal from Lite Bite. After walking by many times, I came in for the first time today to grab a Sunday Dinner for my boyfriend and I. I got 2 portions of the chicken enchiladas, the quinoa with corn and jalepenos, and the broccoli rabe. Every part of the dish had tons of flavor and was completely satisfying! For less than 400 calories for each of us, we both felt that this was as good, if not better than the typical 1000-1200 calorie delicious mexican meal! We will definitely be back! The meals are affordable and guilt-free while being tasty...even for my boyfriend who could eat pizza and burritos for every meal! Yum!
author: Michelle N.

description: Another fast, easy and great place to eat in my neighborhood! The only difference this place is actually healthy! The people working there are always friendly. Love that they use all compostable products and that the nutrition facts are listed!
author: Jamaica S.

description: This place is such a welcome addition to the neighborhood! You can taste and feel that their food is made with care and attention -- very healthy and wholesome... It's almost like having someone cook for you at home :-)
author: Carey C.

description: It's a clean and simple place with a good variety of healthy and delicious food with calories listed on everything. I opted for something quick and easy: the grilled vegetable sandwich. It had squash, eggplant, sundried tomatoes, and cheese. The workers were very pleasant and nice. They warmed it up in a panini press for me. I'm usually a meat and rice type of girl, but this sandwich was so good despite the lack of meat! All of the other food looked amazing & I would like to try everything here if I lived closer to sf.
author: Kim N.

description: Lovely little place. I was disappointed in the lack of salads in the lettuce variety, but they had plenty of vegetables available as salad. The girl behind the counter was very helpful and let me sample a couple of things before I decided what I wanted. I had the turkey meatballs (tasty), beef skewers (yum), and eggplant salad (double yum). Quick and easy meal.
author: Alicia T.

description: You gotta love a place where the owner greets you with a huge smile and enthusiastically navigates you through all the delish gems in front of you. I seriously can't tell you how refreshing this place is. I bought a piece of Salmon with Pea Puree (shoot, I think thats what they called it! Regardless, the Pea Puree was about the most genius, healthy condiment..WOW). Anyway, this place is fab. GO there, because just as Johnathan Adler says, "Nothing tastes better than skinny"! (I mean healthy!)
author: Elizabeth T.

description: The Fiance and I are watching what we eat before the wedding. We walk by here all the time and decided to see what it was all about. We ended up ordering the turkey meatloaf, polenta, lasagna and chicken enchiladas and taking them home for dinner. We were SO happy we did! Everything was delicious especially the chicken enchiladas and we felt so satisfied with our 500 calorie dinners. This is for sure our new spot- Love it! The service was great and the prices are very reasonable.
author: Sue-sue M.

description: Tasty food! Got the turkey meatloaf and broccoli rabe and it's really satsifying.  Plus there are lots of healthy options.  I'm so glad I wandered in here.
author: Melissa S.

description: Bright and sunny. Pleasant staff. Healthy options. Clean bathroom.
author: Inigo M.

description: Nice atmosphere, natural light, good food, good prices. Recommend.
author: Seamus B.

description: I heart the fig and prosciutto sandwich. 213 delicious calories. Thanks lite bite for making eating out tasty and healthy!
author: Holly S.

description: Very delicious Moroccan Chicken with Couscous!  The chicken was seasoned with a slight kick, and the couscous was full of flavor sweet and savory.  A great and healthy lunch.
author: Kristina P.

description:
healthy food, 3 color dishes, not too spicy or too salty
very polite service
affordable, usually I pay 8-10 USD for lunch
salmon with pea pure is the best
eco-friendly
author: Anna V.

description: Super place for a quick healthy lunch. Food is yummy, light, well prepared. Wish there was a location in Hayes Valley.... Maybe soon?
author: CJ W.

description: I really appreciate this place given that it is so hard to find a healthy place that is so convenient. Mashed cauliflower was awesome, mary's chicken was so juicy and green beans were eh. Will definitely come back soon!
author: Katie D.

description: Delicious, amazing, inexpensive and very very healthy food. I eat there daily in lunch and not going to get bored for few months for sure.
author: Gaurav G.

description:
Just stopped in while running errands. This place is such a welcome treat. For someone on the run and never with much time to think about food- but wanting to eat healthy- this is the spot.

The staff is so friendly and the owner took the time to explain the calorie count listing on the labels as well as the healthy ingredients including free range chicken and organic fed- farm raised salmon. The portions are the perfect size and make eating good food, affordable, and easy. 

I picked up a great bulgur salad and chicken salad sandwich along with pirates booty popcorn. Everything in here is a great find for someone who wants to eat healthy but needs the process to be simple and easy. I love the ready made meal section- after a long day of work - this is the perfect spot to either stop in for lunch or pick something up before heading home for the night. 

I can't wait to try the grilled vegetables and whole wheat lasagna!

Love Lite Bite! Go here.
author: Laurene R.

description: This place is great!  Really, Really super.  Try the Chicken Mole with Polenta.  Holy Mole!
author: Michele P.

description: Best place to pick up food when you don't feel like cooking!!  I eat here frequently throughout the week!  It's delicious, tasty, satisfying food that is healthy and low cal, what more could you ask for!  It's great to be able to eat out and know that you are not sacrificing your health.  The enchiladas are to die for!!  I also enjoy the prices, i can get a meal much cheaper than any restaurant.  GREAT, great, great find!!
author: Allison R.

description:
im kind of obsessed with this place.  These are the things that I love:
1.  they serve what you would want to make for yourself at home, but didn't have the time to (salmon, chicken, meatballs, great salads, grilled veggies, etc) so you're not eating the huge sandwich that you'll regret later.  Feel very home cooked
2. you can pick up something pre-packaged and jet out, or make your own plate with the portions you want.  And you're not limited to picking 2 items, or three items, etc.  So you can do a little of this, a little of that, a lot of that!
3. its really reasonably priced!  You'd think somewhere that had fresh, homemade, healthy food would charge an arm and a leg.  It's so great to go somewhere that doesn't overcharge you for wanting a healthy option.
4. the staff are SOOOO friendly!  

Thanks for coming to the neighborhood!  I look forward to tasting new additions in the future!
author: liz g.

description: Tasty and healthy.  This fills a gap in the neighborhood food choices.  So excited this is finally here.  The soups are tasty and well priced.  All the salads I've tried ( lentil, quinoa, and pasta ) have all been very good.  They are operating at less than full menu and I look forward to increasing this review to 5 stars when I get a chance to see them firing on all cylinders.
author: Bryan M.

description: I love this sort of concept. I really like hot food bars and salad bars of this sort in higher end grocery stores and it has that same vibe. Being able to get a decent sized hunk of lasagna that also has a decent price is also a huge plus for me. However, I have to take a few stars away for presentation and execution. Mostly, the microwaves. Why oh why do you use microwaves!? Am I wrong to think that some of your items could be better heated in a turbo chef, while some could be kept in a chafing dish or something of the sort. Not only is it just weird for me to see someone microwaving my food, everything I have gotten has been unevenly heated. Piping hot in one section and cold in others. Another small gripe would be the amount of nutmeg I always seem to taste in their white lasagne. I'm a huge fan of adding dashes of nutmeg to any sort of dairy-based sauce but it is too much to the point of distracting from the other flavors in the dish.
author: Brittany V.

description: wow had the best HEALTHY food i love this place.ESPECIALLY there service the girl that help you take your order i believe her name is Tania she so sweet and super nice
author: Keila U.

description: If you're looking for a quick, healthy meal on Union Street, this is your place! Lite Bite offers nutritional information on all of their menu items, but it's all healthy and tastes homemade. You can select from pre-packaged fresh meals if you're really in a hurry, or you can order at the counter, sort of like how you would if you were at a deli. I believe it is owned and managed by a couple - he manages the business and works at the counter, while she is the chef and prepares all of the meals. Everything is always very clean, and we've never had a problem getting a seat.
author: J K.

description: I stopped in Lite Bite for the first time this week, and quickly realized that it fills a much needed void in Cow Hollow.  The model is simple - they bake, and prepare fresh salads/ simple dishes onsite, and also run a grill five blocks away - providing freshly made dishes ready to go.  Think of it as the "to go" area at Whole Foods, but even fresher .... and with seating.  It's a great place to stop in for a quick bite, OR grab a healthy $8-$10 meal to go.  I love grilled chicken, meatloaf, mash potatoes, green beans, bbq pork chops, tossed salads, etc, but I simply don't have time to shop,prep, and cook these dishes.  Lite Bite is dialed in for the niche it serves. The owner is very service-centric, and knowledgeable.  I highly recommend. I'm actually going in today for my 3rd meal there this week!
author: Ryan D.

description: Can't believe I haven't reviewed this yet - fantastic edition to the neighborhood.  Light, healthy and great tasting food.  Awesome, truly awesome.
author: Christin A.

description: Wandered in to see what this new place was all about.  The samples on offer were delicious!  Quinoa was light and fresh tasting with a tiny and very welcome 'kick' from jalapenos.  Cauliflower mash was also very tasty and fresh tasting.  Bought some of the kale to go and enjoyed it heated up at home - garlicky, with just enough oil to moisten it.  The eggplant parmigiana looked wonderful and I plan to go back to try it.  Looking forward to seeing the new items they will add to the menu once they are fully up and running.
author: Ash A.

description:
I love this place and honestly feel it is the GREATEST new addition to Union Street.

The owners and employees are so friendly, helpful and happy to offer their suggestions. The food and coffee are so delicious and healthy.

This place is literally a gift to Union Street.

Healthy, organic, well priced eats in a superior location! I am sold.
author: Rhanda S.

description:
I give lite bite 1 star in hopes that they read this and make a positive change. The idea behind this place is great - quality ingredients, transparency with ingredients and nutrition, served in relatively quick time.

However, their marketing is SO NEGATIVE. They have posters in their windows touting "eat guilt free!" and "50% off calories!" which is the dirtiest type of marketing. Why are they suggesting someone should feel guilt when they eat in the first place? Or encouraging obsessive calorie counting? Seems to me that they are trying to prey on people's eating/weight insecurities to get you in the door... which tells me they aren't confident in their product. If they were, their signs would say  "all quality ingredients!" and "complete transparency - we do the thinking for you by making this super healthy, super nutritious, and super fast!" which I'm sure is their intention - it just needs to be executed a little differently. 

I know so many women who "secretly" obsess about the food they eat on a daily basis - whether they are overweight, normal weight, or underweight - and if they eat something they actually enjoy that might be outside of their strict diets they feel immense guilt and beat themselves up for it. While lite bite certainly isn't responsible for that, nor can they control it, if they can play a role in decreasing it and promoting positive self-image, wouldn't they want to? Let's do people a favor and not market to them by feeding in to the negativity then offering a "guilt-free" solution to their "problem". Rather, let's try a positive message and suggest that more important than calorie counting or the endless emotions you feel toward food, is eating high quality food and knowing exactly what's going in to it and that it's healthy for you. Lite bite is taking the first step in a positive direction by offering high quality variety with transparent ingredients and nutrition in a short amount of time - now if they could just let go of their shameful marketing ploys it might actually be an idea that's revolutionary. 

Side note - one person commented on how poorly the guy treats his staff and when I was speaking with him and another member of the staff, she tried to pipe in and he told her not to speak... she literally couldn't add a single word to the convo. It was rude to say the least and gives me the impression this is something he still needs to work on. 

*Lite bite! Give me a reason to change this review into 5 stars and return as a customer by stepping up your positive marketing - I am more than happy to as you've got a great concept. One small change and you'll be the best spot on Union St. *
author: Quinn N.

description: So nice to have a place to pick up some healthy food when you're on the run.  The people here are very nice and helpful. I think the owner Angelo is there most of the time and he is great at recommending different things to try that you will like - and offering samples.  I just wish they would offer some more options like Boulange down the street - maybe more variety of sandwiches?  Maybe some bread?   I like healthy food - but I think they need to include some heartier options, too.
author: Emma L.

description: I discovered this place one evening while I was looking for something quick to grab after a hair appointment in the marina.  Excellent take-out spot!  I try to eat healthy so this place was right up my alley...and reasonably priced!  I got the salmon with pea puree which was delicious!  The salmon was fresh and tender- perfectly cooked with the addition of the pea puree on top!  My boyfriend got the whole wheat lasagna and said it was amazing.  I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for something healthy and quick on the go!
author: Sara W.

description: So the food is ok.  Good concept.  However, I do not like my food microwaved! I also didn't appreciate them making salads with bare hands (hopefully they were clean).  Will not come back.
author: V s.

description: Flavor is eh. This is a great concept, I just wish the food was better. Yes, healthy food can be more flavorful, cooked better and can contain less sugar then items on their menu. I may give it another try if I am in a pinch.
author: Rachel S.

description: I work right across the street from this place, so it's easy to run in and get some healthy food on the go. I just wish they had a larger selection. Or at least more soups and bring sandwhiches back.
author: Christina L.

description:
I like this little deli/restaurant in Cow Hollow  very much.    I have been going there regularly for the last 6 months.  It  has helped me to lose 9 pounds over the summer  (and keep it off).   How can you beat that?
   The food is healthy but also delicious.  The selections are varied and interesting with a mix of cuisines--Italian and Mediterranean included.     I love the fact that you know exactly how many calories each item has because each one is labeled.   If you are counting calories there is no guesswork  and no worry. 
     I usually get the turkey meatballs with sauce and the wonderful polenta.  Also sometimes  their salads  or  roasted beets.   They used to have good mini sandwiches  (ex  prosciutto/fig jam/low /fat blue cheese on  a small ciabbata roll).  But the sandwiches weren't selling so they were discontinued.  Too bad.  They were a perfect bite when on the go.. or just a perfect little snack anytime.  
   We need more eateries like Lite Bite which label the calorie content of their menu.    I wish they were located in various parts of the city.  Lite Bite proves that you can eat healthy  but still have very tasty and interesting meals.
author: Patricia D.

description: great turkey meatballs, a must-try!
author: A S.

description: Finally!!!! A place to grab good food that's HEALTHY for you AND tasty! I've been looking for a place that isn't filled with fat, butter, calories and cholesterol and somewhere i can go to grab a quick bite. It also keeps me in line with my commitment to keep my body healthy and in shape. I love everything about this place! And the people there are so down to earth, sweet, genuine and just lovely. Thank you Lite Bite for coming into our neighborhood!
author: Celeste T.

description: my life savior for me as a hairstylist...never have enough time for lunch, so something quick and HEALTHY helps..and customer service there is amazing..the owner is very helpful, quick and really really nice.. everyone is just super sweet..
author: Marina P.

description: Best place on Union to eat breakfast, lunch or dinner on the go. The owners are really nice and genuinely seem to care about your opinions. The chicken cesar salad is good, but the low calorie count makes it even better. All of the breakfast sandwiches are tasty even the smoked salmon bagel (I'm usually very particular about my smoked salmon, but Lite Bite's is not too smoky or fishy.) The salmon bagel has a slice of apple in it with a cream cheese spread. If you're looking for a healthy, refreshing meal, (not to mention guilt-free) this is the place to go. All good things to say about this place.
author: Kate S.

description:
the place is a gem! super tasty food and super healthy.  this place is my lifeblood.  they are very reasonably priced also. Please expand to the downtown =)

If you don't cook and want to eat healthy.. This is you best choice in SF!
author: R S.

description: Delicious, friendly and reasonably priced.  Lite Bite team - you need to stay open later during the week!
author: Robyn R.

description: ham egg and cheese sandwich was surprisingly tasty and guy behind the counter was super nice
author: Carrie V.

description: Great new addition to Union St. !!! Stopped in with my wife on our way home and found the food excellent. I know their motto is "Lite" however I found the food not lacking in flavor. I had the Turkey Meatballs & Lasagna and found them quite tasty. The price was affordable and the new owners were great. Looking forward to the new additions to the menu as they get going. Thanks for adding a fresh new option to Union St.
author: M H.
